posts.title: What Annoys You More Than Anything (According to Your Zodiac Sign)
posts.markdown: Feel a strong connection with your Zodiac sign?  According to your sign, your pet peeves and the types of things that irritate you can be found in the stars.  Check out your sign and see if it matches up with the things that bother you: **Aquarius – **Ignorance, particularly in those who you think should know better.  Aquarians are progressive, meaning they can’t stand those people who make unfair assumptions about the random nature of life. **Pisces – **People who don’t understand where you’re coming from.  Pisces don’t enjoy sharp criticism; they hate when they’re trying to explain something and their friends can’t seem to get it. **Aries – **You despise people who take *forever* to get anything done.  This sounds like my roommate, he’s always nagging me to get ready quicker because he’s been ready since 15 minutes before we decided on anything. **Taurus – **Taurus are not a fan of change to their routines.  You don’t enjoy friend groups that are full of drama.  Change can be ok, unless it goes so far as to set you back to starting all over again. **Gemini – **The Gemini is not a fan of the dull or boring.  Their firecracker nature causes them to be easily annoyed with being bored.  If the person you’re talking to is about as interesting as watching paint dry, you’re not interested.  They need excitement in all forms. **Cancer – **The Cancer hates invasion of their personal space.  They enjoy keeping their personal lives on the down-low, meaning they don’t like people who like to pry into their lives. **Leo – **Us Leos hate the silent treatment.  If you get into a huge fight with a Leo and then give them the silent treatment, they’re likely going to try to throw you off the top of a building.  Leos like people who are real and honest with them, so silence comes off as a weakness. **Virgo – **Rudeness and meanness for no reason whatsoever really upsets the Virgo.  Virgos are often the ones who get into fights with people over the tone of their voice or unnecessarily poor behavior.   **Libra – **Libras despise people who are seemingly incompetent.  The Libra enjoys order, meaning that those who mess the order up are immediately in the doghouse.  Life isn’t that hard, people need to get their lives together. **Scorpio – **Scorpios despise liars.  They take pride in being the ultimate “no bullsh*t” type of people.  They’ll call out anyone who is practicing being phony.  They don’t accept lies and are pretty blunt about everything. **Sagittarius – **These people hate finding themselves boxed in; they have restless spirits that hate stagnation.  It drives them absolutely nuts to be stuck in a dead-end job that’s leading nowhere, or when they’re in an environment where everything is always the same. **Capricorn – **The Capricorn doesn’t enjoy clingy people.  They’re highly independent people who don’t enjoy those who like to latch on.  Their lovers and partners are no exception, either.  And seeing others become dependent on others upsets them.  People need to learn to fly solo.

posts.title: Welcome to Jpress
posts.markdown:
You're live! Nice. We've put together a little post to introduce you to the jpress editor and get you started. You can manage your content by signing in to the admin area at `<your blog URL>/ghost/`. When you arrive, you can select this post from a list on the left and see a preview of it on the right. Click the little pencil icon at the top of the preview to edit this post and read the next section!

# Getting Started

Ghost uses something called Markdown for writing. Essentially, it's a shorthand way to manage your post formatting as you write!

Writing in Markdown is really easy. In the left hand panel of Ghost, you simply write as you normally would. Where appropriate, you can use *shortcuts* to **style** your content. For example, a list:

* Item number one
* Item number two
    * A nested item
* A final item

or with numbers!

1. Remember to buy some milk
2. Drink the milk
3. Tweet that I remembered to buy the milk, and drank it

### Links

Want to link to a source? No problem. If you paste in a URL, like http://ghost.org - it'll automatically be linked up. But if you want to customise your anchor text, you can do that too! Here's a link to [the Ghost website](http://ghost.org). Neat.

### What about Images?

Images work too! Already know the URL of the image you want to include in your article? Simply paste it in like this to make it show up:

![The Ghost Logo](https://ghost.org/images/ghost.png)

Not sure which image you want to use yet? That's ok too. Leave yourself a descriptive placeholder and keep writing. Come back later and drag and drop the image in to upload:

![A bowl of bananas]


### Quoting

Sometimes a link isn't enough, you want to quote someone on what they've said. Perhaps you've started using a new blogging platform and feel the sudden urge to share their slogan? A quote might be just the way to do it!

> Ghost - Just a blogging platform

### Working with Code

Got a streak of geek? We've got you covered there, too. You can write inline `<code>` blocks really easily with back ticks. Want to show off something more comprehensive? 4 spaces of indentation gets you there.

    .awesome-thing {
        display: block;
        width: 100%;
    }
![](http://)
### Ready for a Break? 

Throw 3 or more dashes down on any new line and you've got yourself a fancy new divider. Aw yeah.

---

### Advanced Usage

There's one fantastic secret about Markdown. If you want, you can write plain old HTML and it'll still work! Very flexible.

<input type="text" placeholder="I'm an input field!" />

That should be enough to get you started. Have fun - and let us know what you think :)

posts.title: This Is What Happens To Your Body When You Stop Eating Sugar
posts.markdown: Sugar has been a pretty hot topic in popular culture as the United States continues to be one of the most overweight and unhealthy countries in the world.  The **[National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases](http://www.niddk.nih.gov/Pages/default.aspx)** reports that more than two in three adults are considered to be overweight or obese, more than one in three adults are considered to be obese, and about one out of every twenty adults are considered to have extreme obesity. I hope everyone recognizes this as a problem.  **[Two-thirds of our population is at risk for major health problems](http://www.niddk.nih.gov/health-information/health-statistics/Pages/overweight-obesity-statistics.aspx)**, and we’ve all but identified the major culprits.  The main one is sugar.  Consumption of high-sugar content drinks and beverages is a major contributor to the obesity epidemic.  Your average 20-ounce soda has anywhere from **[15 to 18 teaspoons of sugar in it, and around 240 calories](http://www.hsph.harvard.edu/nutritionsource/sugary-drinks-fact-sheet/)**.  It’s basically liquid candy, except you don’t feel as “full” after drinking it. **Here are four things that happen to your body when you quit sugar:** **You gain energy – **The more sugar you consume, the more inhibited your body’s ability to sustain energy at maximum levels becomes.  When this happens, our blood sugar levels become imbalanced.  Compared to a person who consumes sugar regularly, those who do not consume sugar benefit from improved ability to generate and store energy.  These people tend to eat foods that are high in energy content, but low in sugar content. **Your weight stabilizes – **If you’re consuming sugar on a regular basis, you’re going to gain weight and there’s no getting around it.  Especially in grown adults, sugar has been seen as directly correlated with extreme weight gain and increased risk of chronic illness.  You often hear of “beer bellies” because, well, they’re actually a thing.  Beer contains a high amount of sugar, which causes fat to build up around our tummy area.  When we quit sugar, our bodies equalize and find a natural balance. **You reduce your risk for chronic illness – ****[Diabetes is one of the most common chronic illnesses](http://www.diabetes.org/)** that is associated with obesity and unhealthy weight.  It’s main contributor is, unsurprisingly, sugar.  What’s even worse is that Diabetes can serve as a form of gateway illness, opening up the floodgates for other chronic illnesses that are at their strongest when the immune system is weak.  Quitting sugar entirely gives one the opportunity to live a chronic-illness-free life. **You’ll start disliking sugar – **Sugar is just like any other chemical in that when you abuse it, your body becomes addicted to it.  Alcohol, tobacco, methamphetamines, uppers, downers, you name it, if you consume them in large quantities and often, your body will crave it.  While just the opposite is true as well: if you stop consuming something altogether, your craving for that substance disappears.  So, do yourself a favor and quit sugar today, or at least limit your intake. h/t[** Top Health News**](http://tophealthnews.net/see-what-happens-to-your-body-when-you-quit-sugar/)

I hope everyone recognizes this as a problem.  Two-thirds of our population is at risk for major health problems, and we’ve all but identified the major culprits.  The main one is sugar.  Consumption of high-sugar content drinks and beverages is a major contributor to the obesity epidemic.  Your average 20-ounce soda has anywhere from 15 to 18 teaspoons of sugar in it, and around 240 calories.  It’s basically liquid candy, except you don’t feel as “full” after drinking it.

Here are four things that happen to your body when you quit sugar:

*You gain energy – *The more sugar you consume, the more inhibited your body’s ability to sustain energy at maximum levels becomes.  When this happens, our blood sugar levels become imbalanced.  Compared to a person who consumes sugar regularly, those who do not consume sugar benefit from improved ability to generate and store energy.  These people tend to eat foods that are high in energy content, but low in sugar content.

*Your weight stabilizes – *If you’re consuming sugar on a regular basis, you’re going to gain weight and there’s no getting around it.  Especially in grown adults, sugar has been seen as directly correlated with extreme weight gain and increased risk of chronic illness.  You often hear of “beer bellies” because, well, they’re actually a thing.  Beer contains a high amount of sugar, which causes fat to build up around our tummy area.  When we quit sugar, our bodies equalize and find a natural balance.

You reduce your risk for chronic illness – *Diabetes is one of the most common chronic illnesses* that is associated with obesity and unhealthy weight.  It’s main contributor is, unsurprisingly, sugar.  What’s even worse is that Diabetes can serve as a form of gateway illness, opening up the floodgates for other chronic illnesses that are at their strongest when the immune system is weak.  Quitting sugar entirely gives one the opportunity to live a chronic-illness-free life.

*You’ll start disliking sugar – *Sugar is just like any other chemical in that when you abuse it, your body becomes addicted to it.  Alcohol, tobacco, methamphetamines, uppers, downers, you name it, if you consume them in large quantities and often, your body will crave it.  While just the opposite is true as well: if you stop consuming something altogether, your craving for that substance disappears.  So, do yourself a favor and quit sugar today, or at least limit your intake.

posts.title: Learn the Dark Side of Each Zodiac Sign
posts.markdown: You often read about all of the different positive characteristics that are associated with your Zodiac sign, but there is a less often mentioned dark side as well.  Read below to find out what yours is: **Aries** You guys are the most impulsive and impatient sign in the Zodiac.  If things aren’t happening quickly, you’re over it.  You can also be very immature, as the youngest sign, and if an idea isn’t yours, you don’t really care about it. **Taurus** The Taurus’ dark side comes in the form of materialism, stubbornness, and laziness.  They don’t like to share, are impossible to argue with and can be self-indulgent. **Gemini** Gemini are the folks with an intense love for life–so much so that it can be a bad thing sometimes.  They have multiple different personalities, meaning they are enigmatic at times.  They love to talk. And talk and talk.  And they interests are so diverse that they struggle to focus on any one thing. **Cancer** Just like the crab, Cancer are incredibly moody people.  They don’t enjoy going out of their comfort zone and can be incredibly sensitive at times.  Chin up, Cancer, it’s not that bad. **Leo** A lesson in vanity and ego.  The Leo thinks they are the most beautiful in all the land, and they’ve got the charm to go with it.  Careful when you’re around them; they’ll smooth talk you into doing things you’ve never even thought of before.  Also, they think they’re the center of the universe. **Virgo** The Virgo is the highly judgmental and pessimistic perfectionist.  Their keen sense for attention to detail keeps them busy in a world full of imperfection.  And they can be drama queens when things aren’t going their way. **Libra** Don’t hold your breath for the Libra–they like to take their sweet time weighing each and every option before committing to anything.  They’re fascinated with pretty things, which is why they spend so much time getting ready before doing anything. **Scorpio** The Scorpio can hold a grudge like no one’s business.  They will make you regret ever wronging them.  They’re master manipulators, pulling strings here and there to get what they want.  And, they enjoy brooding over the sorrowful things in life. **Sagittarius** Being honest is good to a point, but the Sagittarians often take it too far.  They don’t like to sugarcoat things, meaning they’re blunt and straight to the point, even when they shouldn’t be.  They like to think they know everything and they crave excitement, growing bored quickly with old things. **Capricorn** The Capricorn gets lost in their obsession with control.  Living life in the moment is not possible for them.  They can be manipulative in using others for their own needs and they feed off of negative energy. **Aquarius** While the Aquarius likes to think that they stand from a point of objectiveness and logic, they’re often some of the most judgmental people.  As such, they’re quick to give (what they think is) objective and logical advice, even if they don’t fully understand the situation. **Pisces** Opposite the Capricorn, the Pisces has so much “live in the moment” attitude that their lives often lack direction.  Sometimes they can be space cadets, failing to notice the happenings that surround them.  This often leaves them gullible, even if they’re supposedly the oldest and wisest of all the signs. h/t [**Mind Journal**](http://themindsjournal.com/dark-side/)

You often read about all of the different positive characteristics that are associated with your Zodiac sign, but there is a less often mentioned dark side as well.  Read below to find out what yours is:

Aries

You guys are the most impulsive and impatient sign in the Zodiac.  If things aren’t happening quickly, you’re over it.  You can also be very immature, as the youngest sign, and if an idea isn’t yours, you don’t really care about it.

Taurus

The Taurus’ dark side comes in the form of materialism, stubbornness, and laziness.  They don’t like to share, are impossible to argue with and can be self-indulgent.

Gemini

Gemini are the folks with an intense love for life–so much so that it can be a bad thing sometimes.  They have multiple different personalities, meaning they are enigmatic at times.  They love to talk. And talk and talk.  And they interests are so diverse that they struggle to focus on any one thing.

Cancer

Just like the crab, Cancer are incredibly moody people.  They don’t enjoy going out of their comfort zone and can be incredibly sensitive at times.  Chin up, Cancer, it’s not that bad.

A lesson in vanity and ego.  The Leo thinks they are the most beautiful in all the land, and they’ve got the charm to go with it.  Careful when you’re around them; they’ll smooth talk you into doing things you’ve never even thought of before.  Also, they think they’re the center of the universe.

Virgo

The Virgo is the highly judgmental and pessimistic perfectionist.  Their keen sense for attention to detail keeps them busy in a world full of imperfection.  And they can be drama queens when things aren’t going their way.

Libra

Don’t hold your breath for the Libra–they like to take their sweet time weighing each and every option before committing to anything.  They’re fascinated with pretty things, which is why they spend so much time getting ready before doing anything.

Scorpio

The Scorpio can hold a grudge like no one’s business.  They will make you regret ever wronging them.  They’re master manipulators, pulling strings here and there to get what they want.  And, they enjoy brooding over the sorrowful things in life.

Sagittarius

Being honest is good to a point, but the Sagittarians often take it too far.  They don’t like to sugarcoat things, meaning they’re blunt and straight to the point, even when they shouldn’t be.  They like to think they know everything and they crave excitement, growing bored quickly with old things.

Capricorn

The Capricorn gets lost in their obsession with control.  Living life in the moment is not possible for them.  They can be manipulative in using others for their own needs and they feed off of negative energy.

Aquarius

While the Aquarius likes to think that they stand from a point of objectiveness and logic, they’re often some of the most judgmental people.  As such, they’re quick to give (what they think is) objective and logical advice, even if they don’t fully understand the situation.

Pisces

Opposite the Capricorn, the Pisces has so much “live in the moment” attitude that their lives often lack direction.  Sometimes they can be space cadets, failing to notice the happenings that surround them.  This often leaves them gullible, even if they’re supposedly the oldest and wisest of all the signs.

h/t Mind Journal

posts.title: The Salt Lamp: How it Improves Mental Clarity, Air Quality and Sleeping Patterns
posts.markdown: Salt oftentimes doesn’t get the attention it deserves.  Most people only recognize salt as that mineral we sprinkle on our foods to make them taste more flavorful, but salt actually provides a great number of health benefits when used correctly. **[Himalayan Pink Salt](https://www.mountainroseherbs.com/products/himalayan-pink-salt/profile)** has recently become a hot topic because it is thought to be one of the purest salts available today.  Not only does it taste better than regular salt, **[it does everything](http://fitlife.tv/10-amazing-benefits-of-pink-himalayan-salt/),** from balancing your pH to strengthening your bones and lowering your blood pressure. ![2015-03-07_Pakistanisches,_sogenanntes_Himalaya-Salz_0399](http://cdn.davidwolfe.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/2015-03-07_Pakistanisches_sogenanntes_Himalaya-Salz_0399-750x564.jpg) The best part about all of this is that you don’t even have to eat the salt to gain these benefits.  **[Simply having the salt around you](http://www.lahealthyliving.com/natural-remedies-remedies/use-salt-instant-migraine-relief/)**has been seen as helpful when treating things like allergies, insomnia, and even migraines. Hold up. Before you start sprinkling Pink Himalayan Salt around your home, consider a better way.  The much more elegant, and less messy, solution is in the **[form of a lamp](http://www.amazon.ca/gp/product/B001892AX2/ref=as_li_tl?tag=natuliviidea-20&ie=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=390957&creativeASIN=B001892AX2&linkCode=as2&linkId=UYUDTJ3HPR5PHCAW)**.   G.S. Rahi, associate professor of Physical Science at Fayetteville State University, says that “all living systems (including human beings) are bio-electric in nature, [meaning that] electrically charged particles affect the way we feel and act.” Rahi has confirmed that placing salt lamps around your home can work wonders, reducing the amount of unhealthy positive ions that occupy your home space.  There are **[other sources](http://www.naturallivingideas.com/himalayan-pink-salt-lamp-benefits/)** that support the salt lamp as well, claiming that they increase energy levels and concentration; meaning you’ll want to keep a few of them in the bedroom and office. Some lamps are lit by candles and others use low wattage bulbs.  And the Himalayan pink salt reserves are estimated to last another 350 years, given the current rate of mining.  So, instead of buying a traditional new lamp for your end table, maybe try out a salt lamp and see what you’re missing out on.

posts.title: 4 Things You Should Know Before Dating The Person Who Hides Their Anxiety
posts.markdown: Anxiety is an emotional beast that can creep up on anyone, overshadowing them with fear, doubt, and angst.  Oftentimes those with anxiety do not wish to discuss it or openly acknowledge when they are feeling overwhelmed, they don’t enjoy saying that they’re not ok.  Their worst fear could even be to let others see them struggle. Here are four things to know before dating the anxiety-hiding individual: **They’d rather deal with it alone – **They’re not ones to typically enjoy receiving sympathy from others, simply because they acknowledge that others most likely have labeled them as a person who suffers a little too much from anxiety.  “The one who’s vulnerable.”  Anxiety is but one part of their person, but it is the part that they have to fight every time someone wants to get close to them. **They want to help you with your issues, instead of work on theirs – **They highly empathetic because they’ve experienced a great deal of pain in their lives already.  They enjoy helping with literally any problem because of their high level of intuition and high-functioning cognitive abilities.  They are aware of everything. **They go out of their way to make people feel comfortable – **Their awareness and perception allows them to pick up on vibes very easily.  In turn, they are able to hone in on how to make those around them happy and comfortable.  This can make them the life of the party because others instantly feel accepted; which in turn eases *their* anxiety. **They’re extremely strong – **Anxiety will never be an acceptable excuse for not achieving or doing great things.  And this notion often leads them to think that they are invincible, only to end up in tears down the road.  Their anger is often misguided, so please do not take it personally if they blow up on you.  They’ve got love at their cores.

*They’re extremely strong – *Anxiety will never be an acceptable excuse for not achieving or doing great things.  And this notion often leads them to think that they are invincible, only to end up in tears down the road.  Their anger is often misguided, so please do not take it personally if they blow up on you.  They’ve got love at their cores.

posts.title: 5 Ways That Children of Divorce Love Differently
posts.markdown: Divorce is never a fun experience for anyone involved.  The two former partners who no longer feel the same for each other, the kids who grew up seeing their parent’s love flourish only for it to fall apart, the family members that wanted only the best for the relationship.. It hurts everyone.  But especially the kids. Being a child of divorce myself, I can attest that we see things in a different light than others.  We enter into relationships hoping that we can build them to last long, while also recognizing that they probably won’t.  Here are five ways that children of divorce love differently: **Commitment is key for us – **When you’re a kid and you can hear your parents constantly yelling and fighting at one another in the next room, it builds a void in your heart, because you can’t understand why the two most precious people in your life seem to hate one another.  We know how fragile a relationship is, and that nothing is set in stone.  Actions speak louder than words, so show us that you’re committed, don’t just tell us that you are. **Communication is vital – **We’ve seen firsthand how lack of communication can break down even the strongest of relationships.  We’ve heard our parents throw shade at one another in an effort to make the other look bad, which is why it really upsets us when we’re trying to figure out what’s wrong and all we get back is, “It’s nothing.”  Tell us the truth, no matter how harsh it is. **We’re very aware – **Caution is often at the forefront of entering any relationship for the child of divorce.  We like to observe everything, searching day and night for any red flags that might potentially spell out disaster for us or the relationship. **We’re cynical – **While we try to be optimistic about things, we also can’t help but acknowledge the way things are.  Reality is what keeps us grounded.  We know that sometimes things just aren’t meant to be and that things don’t always last forever.  We know that people will get bored with one another and move on eventually. **We love unconditionally – **But that doesn’t keep us from loving with an unrelenting fervor.  We give our partners as much love as we can because we know that nurturing the flame of a relationship takes a steady, careful effort.  We want it to last, so we tend to give a lot of love.

posts.title: Welcome to Ghost
posts.markdown:
You're live! Nice. We've put together a little post to introduce you to the Ghost editor and get you started. You can manage your content by signing in to the admin area at `<your blog URL>/ghost/`. When you arrive, you can select this post from a list on the left and see a preview of it on the right. Click the little pencil icon at the top of the preview to edit this post and read the next section!

## Getting Started

Ghost uses something called Markdown for writing. Essentially, it's a shorthand way to manage your post formatting as you write!

Writing in Markdown is really easy. In the left hand panel of Ghost, you simply write as you normally would. Where appropriate, you can use *shortcuts* to **style** your content. For example, a list:

* Item number one
* Item number two
    * A nested item
* A final item

or with numbers!

1. Remember to buy some milk
2. Drink the milk
3. Tweet that I remembered to buy the milk, and drank it

### Links

Want to link to a source? No problem. If you paste in a URL, like http://ghost.org - it'll automatically be linked up. But if you want to customise your anchor text, you can do that too! Here's a link to [the Ghost website](http://ghost.org). Neat.

### What about Images?

Images work too! Already know the URL of the image you want to include in your article? Simply paste it in like this to make it show up:

![The Ghost Logo](https://ghost.org/images/ghost.png)

Not sure which image you want to use yet? That's ok too. Leave yourself a descriptive placeholder and keep writing. Come back later and drag and drop the image in to upload:

![A bowl of bananas]


### Quoting

Sometimes a link isn't enough, you want to quote someone on what they've said. Perhaps you've started using a new blogging platform and feel the sudden urge to share their slogan? A quote might be just the way to do it!

> Ghost - Just a blogging platform

### Working with Code

Got a streak of geek? We've got you covered there, too. You can write inline `<code>` blocks really easily with back ticks. Want to show off something more comprehensive? 4 spaces of indentation gets you there.

    .awesome-thing {
        display: block;
        width: 100%;
    }

### Ready for a Break? 

Throw 3 or more dashes down on any new line and you've got yourself a fancy new divider. Aw yeah.

---

### Advanced Usage

There's one fantastic secret about Markdown. If you want, you can write plain old HTML and it'll still work! Very flexible.

<input type="text" placeholder="I'm an input field!" />

That should be enough to get you started. Have fun - and let us know what you think :)

posts.title: 5 Best Plants to Grow Indoors for Air Purification
posts.markdown: If you’re like me and like to spend a great deal of your time being outside, surrounded by nature, you can bring a bit of that feeling into your home with the introduction of flora.  Plants in the home provide numerous benefits and they make any empty space look better. Studies have even found that bringing fresh greenery into your abode helps **[decrease stress](http://www.aarp.org/politics-society/advocacy/info-07-2012/health-benefits-of-nature.html)**, lessen **[tension](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18329704)** and promote healing. Place a few of these plants around your home and reap the rewards of having a bit of nature in your life. **The Aloe Plant (shown above)** Aloe is notorious for its use in relieving sunburns, stings, and cuts.  Just as it helps detox our bodies, it also helps detox the air. ** [Air pollutants](http://www.aloearborescens.org/phocadownload/aloe%20health%20efficacy.pdf)**stemming from cleaning products with chemicals are Aloe’s specialty.   And, aloe acts somewhat like a pollution meter, as its leaves will show **[brown spots](http://www.aloearborescens.org/phocadownload/aloe%20health%20efficacy.pdf)** when pollution levels are high. **English Ivy** ![English_Ivy_(Hedera_helix)](http://ta1.universaltelegra.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/English_Ivy_Hedera_helix.jpg) **[NASA](http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2009/02/10/nasas-guide-to-the-best-p_n_165588.html)** released a guide for the best houseplants to grow indoors because of their filtering abilities and English Ivy topped the list.  It is believed to be the best at absorbing formaldehyde, can be hung or put on the ground, only needs moderate levels of sunlight and is incredibly easy to grow. **Rubber Tree** ![HK_Sheung_Wan_18_Po_Hing_Fong_barber_shop_Ficus_elastica_Indian_rubber_tree_Aug-2012](http://ta1.universaltelegra.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/HK_Sheung_Wan_18_Po_Hing_Fong_barber_shop_Ficus_elastica_Indian_rubber_tree_Aug-2012.jpg) Rubber tree is a great plant to start with because it does well in dimly lit areas and cold climates.  It’s a very low maintenance plant that provides is still capable of providing all of the air purification benefits of the other plants. **Snake Plant** ![Snake_Plant_(Sansevieria_trifasciata_'Laurentii')](http://ta1.universaltelegra.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Snake_Plant_Sansevieria_trifasciata_Laurentii.jpg) Snake plant has the capacity to thrive with low levels of water and sunlight.  It’s incredibly efficient at absorbing carbon dioxide, and unlike other plants, it releases oxygen at night.  This makes the snake plant perfect for those wanting a better night’s rest. **Peace Lily** ![800px-Peace_Lily](http://ta1.universaltelegra.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/800px-Peace_Lily.jpg) If you prefer flowers in your home, Peace Lily might be the choice for you.  This gorgeous flower is low maintenance, does well in shaded areas and cooler temperatures, and have been seen to help reduce the amount of toxins found in the air.

If you’re like me and like to spend a great deal of your time being outside, surrounded by nature, you can bring a bit of that feeling into your home with the introduction of flora.  Plants in the home provide numerous benefits and they make any empty space look better.

Studies have even found that bringing fresh greenery into your abode helps decrease stress, lessen tension and promote healing.

Place a few of these plants around your home and reap the rewards of having a bit of nature in your life.

The Aloe Plant (shown above)

Aloe is notorious for its use in relieving sunburns, stings, and cuts.  Just as it helps detox our bodies, it also helps detox the air. * Air pollutants*stemming from cleaning products with chemicals are Aloe’s specialty.  

And, aloe acts somewhat like a pollution meter, as its leaves will show brown spots when pollution levels are high.

English Ivy

NASA released a guide for the best houseplants to grow indoors because of their filtering abilities and English Ivy topped the list.  It is believed to be the best at absorbing formaldehyde, can be hung or put on the ground, only needs moderate levels of sunlight and is incredibly easy to grow.

Rubber Tree

Rubber tree is a great plant to start with because it does well in dimly lit areas and cold climates.  It’s a very low maintenance plant that provides is still capable of providing all of the air purification benefits of the other plants.

Snake Plant

Snake plant has the capacity to thrive with low levels of water and sunlight.  It’s incredibly efficient at absorbing carbon dioxide, and unlike other plants, it releases oxygen at night.  This makes the snake plant perfect for those wanting a better night’s rest.

Peace Lily

If you prefer flowers in your home, Peace Lily might be the choice for you.  This gorgeous flower is low maintenance, does well in shaded areas and cooler temperatures, and have been seen to help reduce the amount of toxins found in the air.

We have teamed up with numerous companies to serve online ads in our content and sidebar. These ads assist in covering the costs that come along with spreading our message and reaching our collective goals.

Research and writing articles
Server and infrastructure upkeep
Promotion and marketing
Funding various projects

Finding advertisers that display relevant content for our niche market has proven to be extremely challenging. We are constantly seeking to improve our advertisement quality and hope to achieve a positive user experience. Please note that we currently do not support or endorse any products or services that are offered through the advertisements on our website.

Public disclosure regarding our use of online advertisements
Clear marking of advertising units to allow visitors to make informed choices
Paid advertisements that do not interfere with the website experience, e.g. no pop-ups, pop-unders, or auto-initiated audio/video
Responsible use of the funds gathered from online advertising initiatives
Questions or comments?

Please contact us if you have any questions or comments regarding our use of online advertisements.

posts.title: Privacy Policy
posts.markdown:
Overview

This Privacy Policy describes the policies and procedures of Heart Centered Rebalancing. (“we”, “our” or “us”) on the collection, use and disclosure of your information on www.heartcenteredrebalancing.com (the “Site”) and the services, features, content or applications we offer (collectively with the Site, the “Services”). We receive information about you from various sources, including: (i) if you register for the Site and the Services, through your user account on the Services (your “Account”); (ii) your use of the Services generally; and (iii) from third party websites and services. When you use the Services, you are consenting to the collection, transfer, manipulation, storage, disclosure and other uses of your information as described in this Privacy Policy.

What Does This Privacy Policy Cover?

This Privacy Policy covers the treatment of personally identifiable information (“Personal Information”) gathered when you are using or accessing the Services. This Privacy Policy also covers our treatment of any Personal Information that our business partners share with us or that we share with our business partners.

This Privacy Policy does not apply to the practices of third parties that we do not own or control, including but not limited to any third party websites, services and applications, such as Facebook (“Third Party Services”) that you elect to access through the Service or to individuals that we do not manage or employ. While we attempt to facilitate access only to those Third Party Services that share our respect for your privacy, we cannot take responsibility for the content or privacy policies of those Third Party Services. We encourage you to carefully review the privacy policies of any Third Party Services you access.

What Information Do We Collect?

The information we gather enables us to personalize, improve and continue to operate the Services. In connection with certain aspects of the Services, we may request, collect and/or display some of your Personal Information. We collect the following types of information from our users.

User Content

Some features of the Services allow you to provide content to the Services, such as written comments. All content submitted by you to the Services may be retained by us indefinitely, even after you terminate your account. We may continue to disclose such content to third parties in a manner that does not reveal Personal Information, as described in this Privacy Policy.

IP Address Information and Other Information Collected Automatically

We automatically receive and record information from your web browser when you interact with the Services, including your IP address and cookie information. This information is used for fighting spam/malware and also to facilitate collection of data concerning your interaction with the Services (e.g., what links you have clicked on).

Generally, the Services automatically collect usage information, such as the number and frequency of visitors to the Site. We may use this data in aggregate form, that is, as a statistical measure, but not in a manner that would identify you personally. This type of aggregate data enables us and third parties authorized by us to figure out how often individuals use parts of the Services so that we can analyze and improve them.

Email Communications

We may receive a confirmation when you open an email from us. We use this confirmation to improve our customer service.

Information Collected Using Cookies

Cookies are pieces of text that may be provided to your computer through your web browser when you access a website. Your browser stores cookies in a manner associated with each website you visit. We use cookies to enable our servers to recognize your web browser and tell us how and when you visit the Site and otherwise use the Services through the Internet.

Our cookies do not, by themselves, contain Personal Information, and we do not combine the general information collected through cookies with other Personal Information to tell us who you are. As noted, however, we do use cookies to identify that your web browser has accessed aspects of the Services.

Most browsers have an option for turning off the cookie feature, which will prevent your browser from accepting new cookies, as well as (depending on the sophistication of your browser software) allowing you to decide on acceptance of each new cookie in a variety of ways. We strongly recommend that you leave cookies active, because they enable you to take advantage the most attractive features of the Services.

This Privacy Policy covers our use of cookies only and does not cover the use of cookies by third parties. We do not control when or how third parties place cookies on your computer. For example, third party websites to which a link points may set cookies on your computer.

Information Related to Advertising and the Use of Web Beacons

To support and enhance the Services, we may serve advertisements, and also allow third parties advertisements, through the Services. These advertisements are sometimes targeted and served to particular users and may come from third party companies called “ad networks.” Ad networks include third party ad servers, ad agencies, ad technology vendors and research firms.

Advertisements served through the Services may be targeted to users who fit a certain general profile category may be based on anonymized information inferred from information provided to us by a user, including Personal Information (e.g., gender or age), may be based on the Services usage patterns of particular users, or may be based on your activity on Third Party Services. We do not provide Personal Information to any ad networks for use outside of the Services.

To increase the effectiveness of ad delivery, we may deliver a file (known as a “web beacon”) from an ad network to you through the Services. Web beacons allow ad networks to provide anonymized, aggregated auditing, research and reporting for us and for advertisers. Web beacons also enable ad networks to serve targeted advertisements to you when you visit other websites. Because your web browser must request these advertisements and web beacons from the ad network’s servers, these companies can view, edit or set their own cookies, just as if you had requested a web page from their site.

Aggregate Information

We collect statistical information about how both unregistered and registered users, collectively, use the Services (“Aggregate Information”). Some of this information is derived from Personal Information. This statistical information is not Personal Information and cannot be tied back to you or your web browser.

How, and With Whom, Is My Information Shared?

The Services are designed to help you share information with others. As a result, some of the information generated through the Services is shared publicly or with third parties.

posts.title: Relieve Sinus Pressure in Under 30 Seconds With This Simple Method
posts.markdown: With us working our way through Spring and heading into Summer with full force, allergy season is upon us.  These are the times when most of our allergies start to flare up, causing us tremendous amounts of agony and suffering at the hands of congested airways, itchy eyes and sinuses full of pressure. If you’re rife with allergies like myself, then you know just how horrible it can be. But you can prepare yourself at least a little bit by adding this simple method to your arsenal of allergy relief solutions.  And while it might not fix your sinus problems in a permanent way, it will at least relieve some of that sinus congestion that you’re experiencing at the time. If you’re trying to keep sinus congestion to a minimum, spicy foods and drinking a ton of water are other great ways to help keep pressure from building up. **The Method** When you do this technique, your sinuses will most likely drain almost instantly.  This method works due to the movement of the vomer bone, which rests in your nasal passage.  This bone is capable of swinging back and forth with the pressure, which in turn loosens up the phlegm and grossness stuck in your sinuses. 1. Press your tongue to the roof of your mouth and apply pressure (not too much). 2. Press your thumb between your eyebrows 3. Press your thumb down for 30 seconds while applying a fair amount of pressure Pretty sweet, right?  Remember this method the next time you or your friend’s sinuses are chock-full of phlegm and you find yourself hating life!
posts.html:
With us working our way through Spring and heading into Summer with full force, allergy season is upon us.  These are the times when most of our allergies start to flare up, causing us tremendous amounts of agony and suffering at the hands of congested airways, itchy eyes and sinuses full of pressure.

If you’re rife with allergies like myself, then you know just how horrible it can be.

But you can prepare yourself at least a little bit by adding this simple method to your arsenal of allergy relief solutions.  And while it might not fix your sinus problems in a permanent way, it will at least relieve some of that sinus congestion that you’re experiencing at the time.

If you’re trying to keep sinus congestion to a minimum, spicy foods and drinking a ton of water are other great ways to help keep pressure from building up.

The Method

When you do this technique, your sinuses will most likely drain almost instantly.  This method works due to the movement of the vomer bone, which rests in your nasal passage.  This bone is capable of swinging back and forth with the pressure, which in turn loosens up the phlegm and grossness stuck in your sinuses.

  1. Press your tongue to the roof of your mouth and apply pressure (not too much).
  2. Press your thumb between your eyebrows
  3. Press your thumb down for 30 seconds while applying a fair amount of pressure

Pretty sweet, right?  Remember this method the next time you or your friend’s sinuses are chock-full of phlegm and you find yourself hating life!

posts.title: This Is What Rosemary Does to Your Brain
posts.markdown: Research Shows Smelling Rosemary Increase Memory Function by 75% Boost Your Memory Function by 75% by Smelling Rosemary **[Rosemary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosemary)**is a great herb to have around at pretty much all times.  It’s the woody herb that has the pungent, evergreen, needle-like leaves that are typically accompanied by white, pink, purple or blue flowers.  It’s a member of the mint family and its name, translated from Latin, means “dew of the sea.” It’s an herb that has been used in traditional medicines over the generations and now one study has found out a few reasons why: Rosemary contains **[carnosic acid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnosic_acid)**which is known for combating free radical damage in our brains and in our DNA. Additionally, researchers found the chemical compound **[1,8-cineole](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eucalyptol)**, which is largely responsible for enhanced memory function. The study, which has been published in ***[Therapeutic Advances in Psychopharmacology](http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/02/27/rosemary-brain-memory-18-cineole_n_1304250.html)***, discovered that rosemary can actually improve memory function by up to 75 percent, simply by smelling it! So, if you’ve never been savvy to the benefits of rosemary, now is the perfect time to pick some up or plant some in your garden!

Research Shows Smelling Rosemary Increase Memory Function by 75%

Boost Your Memory Function by 75% by Smelling Rosemary

Rosemaryis a great herb to have around at pretty much all times.  It’s the woody herb that has the pungent, evergreen, needle-like leaves that are typically accompanied by white, pink, purple or blue flowers.  It’s a member of the mint family and its name, translated from Latin, means “dew of the sea.”

It’s an herb that has been used in traditional medicines over the generations and now one study has found out a few reasons why:

Rosemary contains carnosic acidwhich is known for combating free radical damage in our brains and in our DNA.

Additionally, researchers found the chemical compound 1,8-cineole, which is largely responsible for enhanced memory function.

The study, which has been published in Therapeutic Advances in Psychopharmacology, discovered that rosemary can actually improve memory function by up to 75 percent, simply by smelling it!

So, if you’ve never been savvy to the benefits of rosemary, now is the perfect time to pick some up or plant some in your garden!

posts.title: 5 Subtle and Surprising Ways That Your Dog is Saying 'I Love You'
posts.markdown: If you’re a dog owner then you know just how rewarding it can be.  Dogs are known as “man’s best friend” for a reason, because they’ve been our trusted sidekicks for as long as we can remember.  And as it turns out, all of the time that we’ve spent together over the centuries has led to dogs developing unique and subtle ways of expressing their love for us. While we might not be able to communicate with them like Doctor Dolittle, we will at least know when they’re feeling loved and want to give some love back.   The ways that they express their love are not always obvious, but we’ll discuss at least five different practices they like to do to show their human companions love and support: **Staring straight into your eyes** According to a *60 Minutes *segment featuring well-known dog expert, Brian Hare, when dogs look you in the eye, they’re actually “hugging you with [their] eyes.”   When you and your buddy are playing together or having a nice cuddle session, the same hormone that helps mothers and babies bond, oxytocin, is released in the dog’s brain.   Try keeping eye consistent eye contact with them as you go about your normal daily routine with them, but do not actively stare them down, as it will only make them feel uncomfortable. **Sharing yawns** We all know that yawning is one of the most contagious things in the world, but what you might not have known is that it’s not limited to humans.   Dogs have been bred by humans to understand humans, so when you yawn, your doggy companion will likely reciprocate the gesture. **Leaning on you** Dogs like to lean on their companions for a variety of reasons, like anxiety or wanting you to do something or take them somewhere, but it is also used to express affection. Even if anxiety is the sole reason they’re leaning on you, they’re doing this because they recognize you as a source of protection and safety. **Sleeping in your room** Take note of where your buddy likes to sleep.  If your dog likes to catch his Z’s in your bed, even when you’ve told him numerous times that he’s not allowed up there, it’s only because he loves you.   According to Gregory Berns, a dog sleeping in your bed is indicative of a strong sense of loyalty, as they fear being separated from the pack. **Bringing you their favorite toy** Even though wanting to play is a sign of affection in and of itself, many dogs aren’t bringing you their prized toy because they want to play.   It’s usually because they want to please you and think that you’ll enjoy it just as much as they do! Share this information with all of your friends and family members who love dogs so they can recognize when they’re being loved on by their poochy companions!

The ways that they express their love are not always obvious, but we’ll discuss at least five different practices they like to do to show their human companions love and support:

Staring straight into your eyes

According to a 60 Minutes segment featuring well-known dog expert, Brian Hare, when dogs look you in the eye, they’re actually “hugging you with [their] eyes.”  

When you and your buddy are playing together or having a nice cuddle session, the same hormone that helps mothers and babies bond, oxytocin, is released in the dog’s brain.  

Try keeping eye consistent eye contact with them as you go about your normal daily routine with them, but do not actively stare them down, as it will only make them feel uncomfortable.

Sharing yawns

We all know that yawning is one of the most contagious things in the world, but what you might not have known is that it’s not limited to humans.  

Dogs have been bred by humans to understand humans, so when you yawn, your doggy companion will likely reciprocate the gesture.

Leaning on you

Dogs like to lean on their companions for a variety of reasons, like anxiety or wanting you to do something or take them somewhere, but it is also used to express affection.

Even if anxiety is the sole reason they’re leaning on you, they’re doing this because they recognize you as a source of protection and safety.

Sleeping in your room

Take note of where your buddy likes to sleep.  If your dog likes to catch his Z’s in your bed, even when you’ve told him numerous times that he’s not allowed up there, it’s only because he loves you.  

According to Gregory Berns, a dog sleeping in your bed is indicative of a strong sense of loyalty, as they fear being separated from the pack.

Even though wanting to play is a sign of affection in and of itself, many dogs aren’t bringing you their prized toy because they want to play.  

It’s usually because they want to please you and think that you’ll enjoy it just as much as they do!

posts.title: 5 Signs You're Gluten Intolerant
posts.markdown: It seems like the term “gluten-free” randomly popped into mainstream culture not that long ago, with many people claiming that a sensitivity to gluten, a protein that is found in wheat, barley, and rye, causes them to suffer gastrointestinal problems, joint pain, fatigue, and even depression. While some have written the condition off as simply a new fad among dieters and nutritionists, it is very real.  In fact, celiac disease, which is the most serious type of gluten intolerance, **[occurs in 1 out of every 100 people](https://celiac.org/celiac-disease/what-is-celiac-disease/)** across the globe. Here are five signs that you have a gluten intolerance: **Unexpected weight gain** If you’ve suddenly packed on some pounds without any changes to diet or exercise, you might be gluten intolerant.  Weight gain from a gluten intolerance happens because of two reasons: malabsorption and gut permeability (two side effects of gluten intolerance), and the onset of systemic inflammation, which is caused by gluten. Avoid gluten for a while and see if your weight goes back to normal. **Headaches and Migraines** Migraines and headaches have been found to be much more common in those who are gluten intolerant.  In fact, a study looking at a gluten sensitive group of people found that 56 percent of them suffered from chronic headaches and migraines, compared to 14 percent of the control group. **Fatigue / Exhaustion** While research regarding the effect that gluten has on fatigue and exhaustion is scarce, many medical professionals believe that a gluten intolerance can cause these effects through inflammation and de-allocation of the body’s energy reserves. **Skin Problems** Skin problems can arise from a gluten intolerance because of its aforementioned malabsorption traits that affect various different areas of our bodies.   **[Gluten has been correlated](http://www.coreonehealth.com/gluten-sensitivity-and-female-hormones)**with acne, psoriasis, eczema, and dermatitis herpetiformis (DH).  Symptoms can include burning sensations, redness, rashes, itchiness and sometimes blistering. **Dental Problems** A study published in *BMS Gastroenterology* found a link between gluten sensitivity and “aphthous stomatitis,” which is a condition that exhibits recurring mouth ulcers and canker sores.   Additionally, because of gluten’s malabsorption properties, calcium levels are often lowered, resulting in poor dental health.

It seems like the term “gluten-free” randomly popped into mainstream culture not that long ago, with many people claiming that a sensitivity to gluten, a protein that is found in wheat, barley, and rye, causes them to suffer gastrointestinal problems, joint pain, fatigue, and even depression.

While some have written the condition off as simply a new fad among dieters and nutritionists, it is very real.  In fact, celiac disease, which is the most serious type of gluten intolerance, occurs in 1 out of every 100 people across the globe.

Here are five signs that you have a gluten intolerance:

Unexpected weight gain

If you’ve suddenly packed on some pounds without any changes to diet or exercise, you might be gluten intolerant.  Weight gain from a gluten intolerance happens because of two reasons: malabsorption and gut permeability (two side effects of gluten intolerance), and the onset of systemic inflammation, which is caused by gluten.

Avoid gluten for a while and see if your weight goes back to normal.

Headaches and Migraines

Migraines and headaches have been found to be much more common in those who are gluten intolerant.  In fact, a study looking at a gluten sensitive group of people found that 56 percent of them suffered from chronic headaches and migraines, compared to 14 percent of the control group.

Fatigue / Exhaustion

While research regarding the effect that gluten has on fatigue and exhaustion is scarce, many medical professionals believe that a gluten intolerance can cause these effects through inflammation and de-allocation of the body’s energy reserves.

Skin Problems

Skin problems can arise from a gluten intolerance because of its aforementioned malabsorption traits that affect various different areas of our bodies.  

Gluten has been correlatedwith acne, psoriasis, eczema, and dermatitis herpetiformis (DH).  Symptoms can include burning sensations, redness, rashes, itchiness and sometimes blistering.

Dental Problems

A study published in BMS Gastroenterology found a link between gluten sensitivity and “aphthous stomatitis,” which is a condition that exhibits recurring mouth ulcers and canker sores.  

Additionally, because of gluten’s malabsorption properties, calcium levels are often lowered, resulting in poor dental health.

posts.title: Your Zodiac Sign Says A Lot About How You Express Anger
posts.markdown: Anger is one of those emotions that comes out in everyone differently. Some of us have short fuses that ignite some of the biggest bombs ever seen; others let their angry thoughts bounce around inside of them, reluctant to express them. Your Zodiac sign has a lot to do with how you handle your anger. And knowing how to handle your anger is the first step in building healthier, more positive thought patterns. Here is how each Zodiac sign expresses anger: **Aries** As a fire sign, Aries are known for blowing up and fast. They’re not known for starting arguments or conflict, but they’re incredibly good at ending them. If they aren’t ready to do something, or get forced into something, you will likely see the fire within them. But, just as they’re quick to ignite, they’re quick to forgive and forget. **Taurus** It takes a lot to anger the Taurus, but, should you succeed, good luck trying to make it out alive. They don’t like to waste their energy on angry thoughts, but if you betray them, are disloyal or treat them as inferior, they’re ready to rumble. Give them the time and space they need to calm down as they can stay angry for long periods of time. **Gemini** It’s anyone’s guess as to how the Twins will express their anger. They like to cut deep wounds with a calm, centered demeanor, and they absolutely love to talk. So, if you piss them off, you will undoubtedly get an earful. Just don’t tell them what to do and they’ll likely forgive you. **Cancer** Underneath the Cancer’s hard and protective shell lies a loyal, understanding and sweet being whose only wish is for people to return their affection. This is what usually upsets the Cancer; feeling unloved or unappreciated. You can always tell when a Cancer is angry because they’ll usually sulk around passive-aggressively. Don’t ignore their pleas, it will only hurt them more. **Leo** An angry Leo has no trouble telling you exactly how they feel. Ranting, raving, kicking, screaming.. The leo is very capable of making a grand spectacle. And, they’re quick to say things that really hurt, so if they do, just know that it’s one of the only ways they know how to release their anger: venting. They’re not likely to hold a grudge, however, and will probably move past most conflicts fairly fast. **Virgo** Known for being both patient and loving, the Virgo has a great capacity for abuse before being set off in an angry way. Because they like to avoid confrontation, Virgos will often become incredibly passive aggressive. They’re not going to hold a grudge, but they’re not going to forget about what you did, either. **Libra** As a peacekeeper, the Libra’s scales fit perfectly here. Balance is valued in everything, especially relationships. This means that confrontation is often avoided, and emotions get bottled up. Even when they’re at the peak of their frustration, Libras do their best to wear a happy face as they hold back their rage. If the hurt is great enough, they are definitely capable of holding a grudge. **Scorpio** Similar to other signs, the Scorpio doesn’t let out anger as it comes to them. You can always tell if a Scorpio is angry by looking into their eyes. Their eyes will say more than anything. They’re usually venting in their minds, planning their next move. If they suddenly get really quiet and you see angry eyes come out, give them some space. And don’t try to force them into anything before they’re ready. **Sagittarius** Surefire ways to piss off a Sagittarius include dishonesty, disloyalty, being cruel and spewing hate speech. While they tend to be a patient sign, and they don’t angry very often, when they do get angry they’re not interested in playing nice, *at all*. You’ll know they’re starting to get angry when the heavy sarcasm starts pouring out. **Capricorn** As an Earth sign, Capricorns aren’t too pent up with anger. They like to keep things easy-going, but also have a threshold you can reach. You’re most likely to piss them off by accidentally messing up the ‘zen’ of their space. Capricorns get angry for seemingly random reasons, and they don’t like to express it. They enjoy sulking before they’re ready to throw a tantrum. **Aquarius** Arguing is the last thing the Aquarius wants to do, so that’s what they tend to avoid, choosing to completely ignore people instead. If they can’t seem to get away from whatever it is that’s upsetting them, they’re likely to blow up just because of how frustrated they are. Depending on who they’re arguing with, they may or may not want to continue the relationship. **Pisces** The Pisces is somewhat volatile, meaning you never know what’s going to light their fuse. If they’re having a bad day already, it’s easier for them to explode. But, they don’t enjoy confrontation and would rather avoid it. If a smoke or a drink won’t help, they know that crying will. Of all the signs, Pisceans tend to cry the most when it comes to anger and frustration. h/t [**SpiritScience**](http://thespiritscience.net/2016/07/13/how-each-sign-of-the-zodiac-expresses-their-anger/)

posts.markdown: The Taurus is known for fighting for the things it values and desires, meaning that if they’ve chosen you, they’re entirely dedicated.  They’re the perfect partners in a relationship, and here are five reasons why: **Their love is like no other love you’ve ever experienced** You’ll quickly learn that you’ll have a hard time trying not to fall for the Taurus fast and hard.  Their passion and sympathy shows how colorful and caring they are, illustrating their deep commitment to the people they choose to keep in their life.  They always go the extra mile to make their partners feel loved. **They want to really *****know***** you** The Taurus excels in figuring out what makes people get excited, whatever it may be.  They’re genuinely interested in what’s happening in your life, meaning it can be hard to hide things as they are very observant.  If you’re having an off day, they’ll pick up on it instantly. **They’re beyond loyal** Once a Taurus finds his or herself in a secure in a relationship, so give and you shall receive. **They feel *****everything*** Taurus are not typically fake or phony people, as they value being genuine to those around them.  They often love to attach meaning and significance to the events that happen in their life.  If you find yourself loving a Taurus, know that they’ll likely want to see how far you two can go.  They want to build a lasting and memorable bond that revolves around loving and being loved.

Once a Taurus finds his or herself in a committed relationship, they’re in it for the long haul.  Devotion is no trouble for the Taurus and they’re the best at following through on promises.  Their passion comes out once they feel safe and secure in a relationship, so give and you shall receive.

They feel *everything*

Taurus are not typically fake or phony people, as they value being genuine to those around them.  They often love deeply, meaning they’ll show their love interest tremendous kindness and generosity.  However, taking advantage of the Taurus’ love and kindness will quickly give them reason to leave.  They can get sensitive at times, but reassuring them that things will turn out alright will rest their troubled minds.

They love intimate relationships

For the Taurus, love is a powerful thing.  And they love to attach meaning and significance to the events that happen in their life.  If you find yourself loving a Taurus, know that they’ll likely want to see how far you two can go.  They want to build a lasting and memorable bond that revolves around loving and being loved.

posts.title: Dealing With Heartbreak Using Your Zodiac Sign
posts.markdown: If you’re going through a tough time and have had to separate from your partner recently, you might be left feeling lost and confused.  Heartbreak affects everyone differently, and your zodiac sign has a lot to do with that. Here’s a bit of insight as to how each sign handles the pain of heartbreak, so that you might grow a little easier: **Aquarius** Getting close to people is difficult for you, so when you do fall, you fall hard; which makes breaking up that much harder.  You’re not one to outwardly express the pain you’re feeling because you don’t like feeling vulnerable, so you stay busy and speak only to those who are close to you. **Pisces** You’re likely to fully embrace the sadness and sorrow accompanied with most breakups, but you do so because you are not worried about being vulnerable or showing ‘weakness.’  You know that to fully heal you must finish your grieving. **Aries** When the Aries gets hurt, they tend to look to their friends for support because of how social and outgoing they are.  Aries like to stay busy when they’re hurting; this lets them cover their pain with work and activities, pretending as if it hasn’t phased them. **Taurus** The Taurus struggles at times to adequately express how they’re feeling and what they’re thinking.  You’re quick to be set off as you occasionally let your emotions flare up, but you have only kindness in your heart, and want someone who loves as deeply as you do. **Gemini** Gemini tend to live in the moment, so a failed relationship or parting of ways is simply water under the bridge.  They like to focus on what’s happening *now*, instead of what happened yesterday. **Cancer** Cancers fall back on their career or work during times of emotional duress because they are natural leaders and enjoy working.  You like to hide your sensitive side, not letting your personal life and work life intersect.  And your friends are always the focus after a heartbreak. **Leo** Leos are traditionally both loyal and faithful people, enjoying passionate relationships with their partners.  Because of this, they are often shocked when their partner wishes to separate.  Leos will undoubtedly be hurt, but are also very understanding, wishing their partners the best as they move in a different direction. **Virgo** Virgos struggle to commit to one person, meaning they take breakups pretty hard.  But that doesn’t mean they’ll stay down for long.  They’re usually the first ones to be back in the dating scene, doing their best to move on–which they will. **Libra** The usually optimistic and upbeat Libra doesn’t stay hurt for long.  You might even be willing to stay friends with your former partner.  You will most likely spend most of your time with friends and family after a heartbreak. **Scorpio** Scorpios are quick to become reclusive, wanting to deal with their emotions by themselves.  They don’t like others seeing how hurt they are, so they simply pretend that they’re not.  You’ll likely try to stay busy to avoid thinking about it.  Scorpios are very difficult to love, but they are also the most sensitive. **Sagittarius** The Sagittarius, being the carefree and lighthearted creatures that they are, tend to shrug off most breakups or separations.  That’s because the easiest way to deal with anything is to laugh, even when things are tough or sad.  But it’s a trait that the next person will absolutely love. **Capricorn** Capricorns take time to let people into their lives, but it’s always worth it because they are the best people to love.  Anyone who has broken up with you will come to regret it.  The Capricorn simply needs to give him or herself time to heal after a nasty breakup, even if it might take a lot of it. h/t [**Puckermob**](http://www.puckermob.com/relationships/the-ways-you-deal-with-heartbreak-based-on-your-zodiac-sign)

You’re likely to fully embrace the sadness and sorrow accompanied with most breakups, but you do so because you are not worried about being vulnerable or showing ‘weakness.’  You know that to fully heal you must finish your grieving.

Aries

When the Aries gets hurt, they tend to look to their friends for support because of how social and outgoing they are.  Aries like to stay busy when they’re hurting; this lets them cover their pain with work and activities, pretending as if it hasn’t phased them.

Taurus

The Taurus struggles at times to adequately express how they’re feeling and what they’re thinking.  You’re quick to be set off as you occasionally let your emotions flare up, but you have only kindness in your heart, and want someone who loves as deeply as you do.

Gemini

Gemini tend to live in the moment, so a failed relationship or parting of ways is simply water under the bridge.  They like to focus on what’s happening now, instead of what happened yesterday.

Cancer

Cancers fall back on their career or work during times of emotional duress because they are natural leaders and enjoy working.  You like to hide your sensitive side, not letting your personal life and work life intersect.  And your friends are always the focus after a heartbreak.

Leo

Leos are traditionally both loyal and faithful people, enjoying passionate relationships with their partners.  Because of this, they are often shocked when their partner wishes to separate.  Leos will undoubtedly be hurt, but are also very understanding, wishing their partners the best as they move in a different direction.

Virgo

Virgos struggle to commit to one person, meaning they take breakups pretty hard.  But that doesn’t mean they’ll stay down for long.  They’re usually the first ones to be back in the dating scene, doing their best to move on–which they will.

Libra

The usually optimistic and upbeat Libra doesn’t stay hurt for long.  You might even be willing to stay friends with your former partner.  You will most likely spend most of your time with friends and family after a heartbreak.

Scorpio

Scorpios are quick to become reclusive, wanting to deal with their emotions by themselves.  They don’t like others seeing how hurt they are, so they simply pretend that they’re not.  You’ll likely try to stay busy to avoid thinking about it.  Scorpios are very difficult to love, but they are also the most sensitive.

Sagittarius

The Sagittarius, being the carefree and lighthearted creatures that they are, tend to shrug off most breakups or separations.  That’s because the easiest way to deal with anything is to laugh, even when things are tough or sad.  But it’s a trait that the next person will absolutely love.

Capricorn

Capricorns take time to let people into their lives, but it’s always worth it because they are the best people to love.  Anyone who has broken up with you will come to regret it.  The Capricorn simply needs to give him or herself time to heal after a nasty breakup, even if it might take a lot of it.

h/t Puckermob

posts.title: 5 Ways the "Old Soul" Loves Differently
posts.markdown: Ah, the ‘Old Soul.’  If you’re an old soul or have a friend who’s one, you know that we’re a little different from everyone else.  For whatever reason, we seem to handle ourselves better around older people and feel that our views on life are a little “before our time.”  This is why we enjoy spending time alone fairly often, because we’re misunderstood by our peers. However, that doesn’t mean we’re lonely people.  We’re just capable of enjoying the company we can provide ourselves.  We’re also pretty different when it comes to romance and relationships. Here are five things to know about how the old soul loves differently: **They’re homebodies** The homebody is the person who would rather stay in on Friday night instead of going out.  And they’re looking for a partner who shares this sentiment.  Bring over a bottle of wine, maybe some candles, and enjoy a relaxed night of conversation and good company. **Not too concerned with material objects** Old souls are anything but materialistic, so don’t have high expectations for a giant diamond ring or brand new luxury car.  They enjoy expressing their affection through grand gestures that have deeper meaning, like love letters or poems. **Old Souls communicate better than anyone else** Playing games is something that the old soul simply doesn’t entertain when it comes to communication.  They’re going to tell you how they honestly feel, so don’t get caught too off guard by this; they have good intentions at heart. **They only open up to select people** The old soul is almost incapable of having one night stands, simply because the only people they enjoy sleeping with are those who they’re emotionally invested in.  Sex without emotion, or a deeper connection, is meaningless, so don’t be surprised when they don’t open up immediately. **Everything is done with purpose** The old soul is constantly thinking about the big picture. Meaning, if that picture doesn’t include you, they’re not going to keep you around.  “Settling” for a person is not something they’ll do; their partner is their partner because they want it that way and they see a future with that person.   Rarely ever will an old soul do something without good reason. h/t [**Rebel Circus **](http://www.rebelcircus.com/blog/how-the-old-soul-loves-differently/)

posts.title: 5 Ways to Tell You're Arguing With a Psychopath
posts.markdown: Mainstream media and popular culture would have us believe that most psychopathic people are similar to **[Christian Bale in ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Psycho_(film))*****[American Psycho](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Psycho_(film))**: *seemingly normal and charismatic on the outside, but a vicious killer on the inside.  The truth is that most psychopathic people are not serial killers, they’re simply manipulative people who enjoy causing harm to others.  And they do so without empathy or remorse. A psychopath is social being, able to blend perfectly into whatever setting they find themselves in.  Their dark side comes out when they feel threatened or bored, dragging you into arguments you don’t want to have and that quickly become out of control. Here are five signs that you’re engaging with a psychopath and need to leave, immediately: **They lie and have an excuse for everything – **A psychopath has more excuses than they know what to do with, and they’ll often get caught up in their lies and schemes after telling too many people a different tale.  They never follow up their words with action, so when they actually do something they said they were going to do, it’s relieving.   **They condescend and patronize – **Getting under a person’s skin is the psychopath’s favorite thing to do, and when they achieve this effect, they use it to gain the advantage in the argument.  They like to remain calm and composed throughout the argument, as if they’re confused as to why you’re getting so upset.  When you finally blow up, they like to tell you to calm down or act like they’re disappointed. **They are masters of hypocrisy – **A psychopath likes to lure you into their game.  When things become heated, one of their cheapest tricks is to blame you for acting in the same fashion that they themselves act.  Hoping to get a reaction out of you, they’ll quickly claim that you bear the same poor qualities that they do. **They have split personalities – **Arguing with a psychopath is like arguing with ten different people at once.  They like to ebb and flow back and forth between personas as the argument sees fit.  What if they sense you disengaging from their lies?  Fine, they’ll just apologize and play nice for a little bit.  Not working?  Okay, time to insult and mock again.  Feel like you’re taking crazy pills yet? **You feel that they don’t understand basic emotions – **I’m sure at this point you realize that there’s no arguing with a psychopath, it’s a battle that is lost before it’s begun.  You want to explain to them the basic understanding of human emotions so that they might get some sort of inkling as to why you’re feeling the way you’re feeling.  You think that if only they knew of empathy and compassion, they might not be so terrible.  But they do know.  They know so well that they use it to torment others. The only way to avoid these arguments altogether is to simply avoid situations with a psychopath, but if you cannot, never engage with their antics.  Do everything within your power to ignore them and continue on with your life. h/t [**The Mind Journal **](http://themindsjournal.com/6-signs-youre-arguing-with-a-psychopath/)

posts.title: Japanese Master Controls Animals With Power of Chi
posts.markdown: While much of the modern world is dictated by science and practical figures that have basis in reality, there have been and will continue to be, ancient methods and practices of meditation that allow one to transcend normal boundaries.   You might have heard about ‘**[chi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qi)**’, or the material energy, the life force that resides within us.  It is the underlying principle in traditional Chinese medicine and martial arts, and for thousands of years people have tried to channel this energy, so as to use it to their benefit. And why not? As those who have tried to do so and been successful have gone on to accomplish great feats.  Using chi energy, individuals have been able to push the limits of concentration, longevity and strength.   The practice of cultivating this energy is known as Qigong.  Kanzawa Sensei is one such individual who is notorious for his ability to influence animals by using his mind and chi energy.  This Japanese master demonstrates his rare ability by standing close to animals and then concentrating his mind. Using his hands to manipulate chi energy, he can calm, entrance or even put these creatures to sleep, and he has done so with many different animals, including buffalo, elephant and ostriches. Master Kanzawa has even been featured on the television show, ‘Stan Lee’s Superhumans’, during which he visits an alpaca ranch in California.  Not only was he able to subdue an entire herd of alpaca, but he used his energy manipulation to help heal an injured alpaca back to full health.   This alpaca was paralyzed in her hind legs and hips and wasn’t eating, as if her jaw had been paralyzed as well.  After 20 minutes of Kanzawa’s chi manipulation, she was up and about, moving like she normally would and eating like she was hungry. Chi energy manipulation, and the healing powers that it holds within it, is testament to a Western world that has become blind to understanding that all of life is connected in subtle and not always so obvious ways. Check out the videos above that show Master Kanzawa at work.
