posts.title: One Easy Trick to Eliminate Gross and Annoying Blackheads Forever
posts.markdown: Blackheads can be some of the most annoying and painful things to deal with, and what’s worse is that most of the products that have been designed to get rid of them, like facial scrubs and adhesive strips, are expensive and only solve the problem temporarily. If you want a highly-effective method that provides lasting effects, all you need is **lemon and salt mixed with some warm water**. Using a small bowl, mix together 1 tablespoon of sea salt, ½ a teaspoon of lemon juice, and 1 teaspoon of warm water.  Once you have the ingredients thoroughly mixed, apply the mixture thoroughly to your entire face, with special attention paid to your blackheads. Using a warm, wet washrag in a circular motion, work the solution into your skin.  For 5 minutes, massage and rub your skin with the washrag.  If you notice it starting to cool off, reheat it, and allow the mixture to set on your skin for another 5 minutes before washing your face with cold water. Using this method a few times each week will net you noticeable results as blackheads continue to break down and stay away. **Why does this happen?** Salt has natural antibacterial properties that help cleanse our pores and unclog them.  Lemon juice is natural acidic, helping to fight off germs and bacteria as well.  The warm water helps this entire process by opening up the pores, allowing the other cleaning agents to do their jobs.   Combine the three together and you get the same result of a chemical peel, but without all of the terrible side effects. Check out the video below for more information and instructions on how to create your own facial cleanse mixture!

posts.title: How To Cope As An Empath in Today's Society
posts.markdown: To be an empath is to be one who feels *much* more than the average person.  And when I say feel, I mean it in every aspect of the word.  Empaths possess senses that are finely tuned and easily stimulated; heightened physical senses, like touch and hearing, are accompanied by heightened awareness of emotions and energies. If this sounds like you, you could be an empath.  As one, you’re prone to absorbing the energies and feelings of those around you, which can be both good *and *bad.  Good, because being around positive people allows you to soak up positive energy, and bad for the same reason.  If you have any toxic or negative people in your life, you’re likely to reflect their mood and energy, becoming toxic and negative yourself. But don’t worry, because there are things you can do to manage your power. First, how can you tell for sure that you’re an empath?  There are numerous indicators, a few of which are listed below: - Sudden nausea after meeting someone unfamiliar or venturing into unfamiliar places - Issues with the solar plexus, including a sensitive digestive tract, stomach pains, or a sinking feeling in the pit of your stomach - You often reflect or mirror the energies and moods of those around you - Your emotions and senses confuse you - Large crowds are overwhelming, making you withdraw from the setting - You feel depressed at random times for seemingly no reason These are all traits that describe a person with a strong empathic affinity.   Now, a few methods and tips for managing your gift, so that you might not feel so exhausted and overwhelmed by the energies you face on a day-to-day basis: - Certain crystals hold energy-deflecting properties.  Try wearing jet, black tourmaline, hematite, or tiger’s eye on the right side of your body.  These help push energy outward, helping you create a protective barrier around yourself. - Bathing in salts, like pink Himalayan salt, does wonders - Develop a way to shield your solar plexus using your hands and arms while visualizing the act as well - Burn sage in and around yourself and the spaces you occupy - Practice saying “no” to people–Be honest and open when you tell them that you simply don’t have the time or cannot assist them at the moment. - Ask for energetic protection from your spiritual guides, angels, and other non-physical helpers - Saying phrases aloud that help you to visualize being protected like: “I am creating a bubble around myself for protection today,” or, “My shields are up now.” Hopefully some of these suggestions can help your empathic side exist happily and harmoniously with the rest of the world.  Be social and confident knowing that you no longer have to hide from overwhelming situations.   h/t [**Mystical Moon**](http://themysticalmoon.blogspot.com/2014/09/how-to-cope-as-empath-in-our-society.html)

posts.title: 5 Reasons the Aquarius is Never Satisfied
posts.markdown: Being in your 20s is crazy enough as it is, but for Aquarians, it can be particularly hectic.  We’re restless in a world of change; nothing seems to make sense, and if the world could slow down just a little bit for us, we’d appreciate it. Being sick and tired of everything is only made worse by our stubborn and detached nature.  But at least we’re clever, we’re independent, and we know what we want and how we’re going to get it.  So why do we never feel satisfied?  Here are five reasons: **Structure makes us feel trapped – **Falling into that normal routine of life is fine for some, but for us it’s a nightmare.  Waking up and doing the same thing day in and day out scares us; we don’t like rules, office jobs, or anything that tries to tell us what to do. **We need complete independence – **While we love our friends and the people we spend time with dearly, we also don’t like having people depend on us.  When people start getting clingy then we might ask for some space. **We thrive on new things, new situations and new ways of doing – **Constant newness is a must in the Aquarian’s life.  Shopping sprees, channel surfing, pub crawling, and serial dating are all things that the Aquarius will enjoy doing.   **We’re the biggest dreamers – **There’s a specific way that the world should work according to us.  Our dreams are grand, and our will to achieve is strong, so when the world doesn’t adhere to our guidelines, it makes us a bit crazy. **We can be the most impatient people in the world – **Patience is most definitely a virtue that we do not possess.  Not only are we not patient with others, we’re even less patient with ourselves, which only further perpetuates our feelings of being forever unsatisfied.

posts.title: Teen Takes Little Sister with Cancer to His First High School Dance
posts.markdown: The bond between siblings has been and always will be one of the strongest connections that two people can share.  As F. Scott Fitzgerald says, “there are all kinds of love in this world, but never the same love twice.”  The love you have for your parents is different from the love you have for your dog, which is different from the love you have for your sibling. I know that the love I have for my younger brother is nothing short of unconditional and enduring, and I think the same goes for AJ Spader, the 15-year-old South Dakota teen that decided his first high school dance was going to be spent with his 10-year-old sister, Rebekah. Rebekah suffers from **[myelodysplastic syndrome](http://www.cancer.gov/types/myeloproliferative/patient/myelodysplastic-treatment-pdq)**, which she was diagnosed with almost four years ago.  Since her diagnosis, multiple treatments, including a bone marrow transplant, have all failed. AJ’s mother said that he “came to us and said, ‘Rebekah might not get to go to her own dance’” acknowledging that his little sister most likely will not get to experience high school.  The family motto, “Unbroken, brave and blessed” was what AJ wrote on a big poster to ask his little sister to the dance. Rebekah even got to pose for pictures with her brother donning a formal dress and her tiara before her and her brother’s friends all went to dinner.  Stephanie Spader, their mom, said that “AJ and his friends embraced her and embraced the situation and didn’t blink twice that a little 10-year-old sister was going to hang out with them” and that that “was the most special thing [for her].”

posts.title: Ever Wonder What the Strange Floaty Things in Your Vision Are? THIS Is Why We Have Them
posts.markdown: Do you know what I’m talking about when I say eye-floaties?  They’re the squiggles and dots that are on our eyes that we see every now and then. Their scientific name is “muscae volitantes,” but they’re often referred to as ‘floaters’ or ‘flying flies.’   You’ve probably noticed them mostly when you’re shifting your eyes around a blank surface.  Most of the time, when we’re out and about and unconcerned with our vision, we don’t really notice eye-floaties. This unique phenomenon happens when proteins in the eye detach, resulting in shadows being cast in the retina.  You don’t need to really worry about them, as they’re not at all dangerous.   And the only times you notice them are when they come close to the retina because our brains naturally filter them out of our vision for us. The video below goes more in-depth about what muscae volitantes actually are and what they can mean for your overall health.  It’s definitely worth it to be educated on this matter!

posts.title: The 5 Stages of Love & Why Everyone Stops at Stage 3
posts.markdown: Love is one of the most highly sought after things in the world, so much so that people often act crazy or entirely unlike themselves when they’ve fallen for someone.  People of all ages want to find love, yet we see an astonishing number of relationships and marriages that fall apart over time. Check out the five stages of love and why most people end up calling it quits after stage three: **Stage 1 – Falling in love** If you’ve never fallen in love before, give it a shot sometime.  It’s one of the craziest experiences that you’ll ever forget.  Falling in love is great for many reasons, but mostly because our brains get flooded with chemicals that are designed to make us feel amazing.   Dopamine, oxytocin, serotonin, testosterone and estrogen are all swirling together to give us butterflies.  When you’re in love, no one call to you otherwise, because you’re 100% certain of the way you’re feeling. **Stage 2 – Coming together as a couple** During stage two, the love between two individuals becomes deeper and a little more mature.  This is the stage when most people want to have children and rear them together, as their bond becomes strengthened.   The individuals start making decisions based around the couple, rather than the individual.  Most people feel that this is the love that will last a lifetime, and they are often the same people that are so taken aback by stage three. **Stage 3 – Becoming disillusioned** Stage three often throws people for a loop because this is the time when one or both people start feeling uncertain about the direction that their relationship is headed.   Stage three is when things start to feel wrong.  You become resentful and angry over the littlest things, you feel less loved and intimate, and you want out.  You want to bring back that spark or chemistry, but you’re unsure of how to do it.   Getting through stage three can be very difficult, but if the couple can survive it, they’ll come out on the other side stronger and more in love than ever. **Stage 4 – Building a real, lasting love** If you can make it through stage three, then stage four is your reward.  Stage four takes place after you’ve gotten to the core of all the pain and conflict and are now working to resolve it.  And part of resolving your issues is understanding that everyone is wounded on some level, and that these wounds play a large role in your relationships.   In fact, ongoing research by The Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACE) Study has shown that childhood trauma can affect our physical, emotional, and relational health in profound ways.   Building a lasting love means wanting to grow and help each other heal your wounds.  Once the two of you start to heal, you’ll notice the chemistry and feelings of true love start to flourish again. **Stage 5 – Using your love to take on the world** The world is often seen as a pretty terrible place and for the most part, it is.  Thinking about the endless amount of conflict and turmoil that plagues every region of the planet can be disheartening; it makes us feel like there’s really nothing we can do individually to help out.   Building a lasting love between just two people is incredibly hard as it is, how can we do that with 7 billion people?  But maybe finding true love and then building a lasting love is the first step in this process.  If we can do this, then maybe we can start looking outward, seeking ways to help the world come together in love.
posts.html:
Love is one of the most highly sought after things in the world, so much so that people often act crazy or entirely unlike themselves when they’ve fallen for someone.  People of all ages want to find love, yet we see an astonishing number of relationships and marriages that fall apart over time.

Check out the five stages of love and why most people end up calling it quits after stage three:

Stage 1 – Falling in love

If you’ve never fallen in love before, give it a shot sometime.  It’s one of the craziest experiences that you’ll ever forget.  Falling in love is great for many reasons, but mostly because our brains get flooded with chemicals that are designed to make us feel amazing.  

Dopamine, oxytocin, serotonin, testosterone and estrogen are all swirling together to give us butterflies.  When you’re in love, no one call to you otherwise, because you’re 100% certain of the way you’re feeling.

Stage 2 – Coming together as a couple

During stage two, the love between two individuals becomes deeper and a little more mature.  This is the stage when most people want to have children and rear them together, as their bond becomes strengthened.  

The individuals start making decisions based around the couple, rather than the individual.  Most people feel that this is the love that will last a lifetime, and they are often the same people that are so taken aback by stage three.

Stage 3 – Becoming disillusioned

Stage three often throws people for a loop because this is the time when one or both people start feeling uncertain about the direction that their relationship is headed.  

Stage three is when things start to feel wrong.  You become resentful and angry over the littlest things, you feel less loved and intimate, and you want out.  You want to bring back that spark or chemistry, but you’re unsure of how to do it.  

Getting through stage three can be very difficult, but if the couple can survive it, they’ll come out on the other side stronger and more in love than ever.

Stage 4 – Building a real, lasting love

If you can make it through stage three, then stage four is your reward.  Stage four takes place after you’ve gotten to the core of all the pain and conflict and are now working to resolve it.  And part of resolving your issues is understanding that everyone is wounded on some level, and that these wounds play a large role in your relationships.  

In fact, ongoing research by The Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACE) Study has shown that childhood trauma can affect our physical, emotional, and relational health in profound ways.  

Building a lasting love means wanting to grow and help each other heal your wounds.  Once the two of you start to heal, you’ll notice the chemistry and feelings of true love start to flourish again.

Stage 5 – Using your love to take on the world

The world is often seen as a pretty terrible place and for the most part, it is.  Thinking about the endless amount of conflict and turmoil that plagues every region of the planet can be disheartening; it makes us feel like there’s really nothing we can do individually to help out.  

Building a lasting love between just two people is incredibly hard as it is, how can we do that with 7 billion people?  But maybe finding true love and then building a lasting love is the first step in this process.  If we can do this, then maybe we can start looking outward, seeking ways to help the world come together in love.

posts.title: How To Make Peace With What Is (& Make it Better!)
posts.markdown: By [**Andrea Schulman**](https://www.facebook.com/raiseyourvibrationtoday/?fref=ts) | [**Raise Your Vibration Today **](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/07/11/make-peace-with-what-is/) The [Law of Attraction](http://www.raiseyourvibrationtoday.com "Raise Your Vibration Today") is all about paradoxes, and this is a big one: *You’ve gotta make peace with what is ****before**** you can get something better.* Most of us learn about the LOA and we immediately want to put it to use to make our lives better. We identify all the things we DON’T have, and we go to work to try to make them happen.  So, we focus on the boyfriend we don’t have yet, the promotion we haven’t gotten, or the weight we haven’t lost yet.  We focus on what is lacking in order to try to create what is wanted into our realities. Unfortunately, this strategy doesn’t work! You’ve gotta make peace with what is first. ## When life isn’t good enough as it is If you focused on why your life isn’t good enough as it is, you only amplify the “my life isn’t good enough” vibe. Then, thanks to the Law of Attraction, your life will continue to feel “not good enough!” Your reality will always reflect back to you your dominant belief structure. For example, you can’t focus on how much your hate your current home and hope you’ll be able to find one you’ll love. Sure, you may move and you may find a new home.  However, rest assured, you will be just as dissatisfied with your new home as you were with the old one.  This is because with the LOA we are always creating whatever is a match to our dominant thought patterns.  If we believe where we live sucks, then where we live must continue to suck. It doesn’t matter where we go or how many times we move. You’d be much more successful in making peace with your current home, and coming to love it as it is.  Once you make peace with your current home, you become a match to homes you love. The universe will knock its socks off to match whatever you’re putting out there. So, if you want your life to be great, you have to start projecting the vibe that says “my life is great now!” This is done by making peace with what is, and loving it as it stands. ## Why so many people project dissatisfaction over satisfaction I know making peace with what is can seem a bit counterintuitive. Most people have been raised to believe they have to improve their lives, and that their lives aren’t good enough as they are. People are also often taught to evaluate the problems in their lives more closely than the blessings. Unfortunately, this social programming keeps many of us stuck in a rut. This is why you know a guy who’s on his third failed marriage. This is why you have a friend who is always sick. This is why so many people go on a different diet every year. When we focus on what’s lacking, we create more lack. On the surface things may change, but it’s just the same shit, different day. Remind yourself of this principle of the LOA on a regular basis. When you find yourself criticizing where you are, remember you are perpetuating lack. Being happy where you stand will make you a match to people, events and situations that reinforce your happiness, not your lack. ## How do you make peace with what is? One thing you can do right now to make peace with where you are is to play the “perspective game.” The perspective game enables you to make peace with where you are in the present moment. To play this game, step into someone else’s shoes and evaluate your life from an alternative perspective.  List out the things you have, and view them from the perspective of* not* having them. Imagine living a life where the things you have right now are still just dreams to you. The bigger the list, the better. Here is a short list of things I have in my life.  To play the perspective game, I write out the list, and then take a moment imagining my life without these blessings:  1. I have two healthy and adorable children. 2. I have a wonderful husband who loves me and treats me like a queen. 3. I have a great relationship with my brother. He is a kindred spirit to me. 4. I have close friends I get to spend lots of time with. 5. I have a bunch of friendly and positive clients and I run my own business. 6. I’m healthy and in good shape. 7. I’ve had an exceptional education, and I have lots of skills and knowledge that benefit me because of it. 8. I live near the beach. 9. I drive my own car. 10. I get to vacation several times every year. 11. I own my own home. 12. I have money in the bank and my expenses are always paid with ease. 13. I really like all of my neighbors. 14. I’ve got an awesome phone and computer and all kinds of cool technological gadgets. To me, each of the items on this list seems very normal to me, because they are each a part of my current reality.  However, these things are HUGE dreams for some people out there. In fact, just looking at this list makes me feel like my life is pretty great.  I can’t even imagine living a life without my relationships, my health or my education. Yet,* *there are people out there who live without these blessings every day. It’s very hard for me to justify dissatisfaction with my life when I look at things from this perspective.  I’m just too grateful for what I have when I look at it this way. ## Why perspective matters When I look at this list through the perspective of those who don’t have what I already have, it reminds me just how blessed I truly am. When I look at my life through this lens, it’s easy for me to make peace with where I am.  ***Related Article:**[20 Heartfelt Ways to Say Thank You](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/01/06/heartfelt-ways-to-say-thank-you/ "LOA Article")* When I look through my life focused on what I *haven’t *created or achieved, it’s much, much easier to feel unfulfilled. I’m not at peace when I evaluate my life based on my unfulfilled dreams.  How at peace I am with my life has everything to do with which perspective I choose to take. In playing this perspective game, you come to see all of the wonderful things you have already created in your life.  You are focused on what you HAVE rather than what you DON’T have.  This projects a vibe that shouts out “I am fortunate in so many ways!” A message like this becomes reinforced in your reality, allowing more and more good things to come into your life. The universe must continue to bless you, if you believe you are blessed. ## Work within the paradox! So, if you are wanting to use the Law of Attraction to improve your quality of life, make sure you are working within the paradox.  You’ve gotta make peace with what is before something better will come along.  Remember, your life is great *right here and now, regardless of where you stand.  *There are always dreams you have achieved, and there are always reasons to be grateful.* *When you acknowledge this truth and declare your life to be great, your life will reflect greatness back to you in spades. How is your life already great? Why is where you stand a wonderful place to be? Feel free to comment below and declare the greatness of your life right now! XO, Andrea ### Are you a student of the Law of Attraction? So, if you want your life to be great, you have to start projecting the vibe that says “my life is great now!” This is done by making peace with what is, and loving it as it stands.

Why so many people project dissatisfaction over satisfaction

I know making peace with what is can seem a bit counterintuitive.

Most people have been raised to believe they have to improve their lives, and that their lives aren’t good enough as they are. People are also often taught to evaluate the problems in their lives more closely than the blessings.

Unfortunately, this social programming keeps many of us stuck in a rut. This is why you know a guy who’s on his third failed marriage. This is why you have a friend who is always sick. This is why so many people go on a different diet every year.

When we focus on what’s lacking, we create more lack. On the surface things may change, but it’s just the same shit, different day.

Remind yourself of this principle of the LOA on a regular basis. When you find yourself criticizing where you are, remember you are perpetuating lack. Being happy where you stand will make you a match to people, events and situations that reinforce your happiness, not your lack.

How do you make peace with what is?

One thing you can do right now to make peace with where you are is to play the “perspective game.” The perspective game enables you to make peace with where you are in the present moment.

To play this game, step into someone else’s shoes and evaluate your life from an alternative perspective.  List out the things you have, and view them from the perspective of* not* having them. Imagine living a life where the things you have right now are still just dreams to you. The bigger the list, the better.

Here is a short list of things I have in my life.  To play the perspective game, I write out the list, and then take a moment imagining my life without these blessings: 

  1. I have two healthy and adorable children.
  2. I have a wonderful husband who loves me and treats me like a queen.
  3. I have a great relationship with my brother. He is a kindred spirit to me.
  4. I have close friends I get to spend lots of time with.
  5. I have a bunch of friendly and positive clients and I run my own business.
  6. I’m healthy and in good shape.
  7. I’ve had an exceptional education, and I have lots of skills and knowledge that benefit me because of it.
  8. I live near the beach.
  9. I drive my own car.
  10. I get to vacation several times every year.
  11. I own my own home.
  12. I have money in the bank and my expenses are always paid with ease.
  13. I really like all of my neighbors.
  14. I’ve got an awesome phone and computer and all kinds of cool technological gadgets.

To me, each of the items on this list seems very normal to me, because they are each a part of my current reality.  However, these things are HUGE dreams for some people out there.

In fact, just looking at this list makes me feel like my life is pretty great.  I can’t even imagine living a life without my relationships, my health or my education. Yet,* *there are people out there who live without these blessings every day.

It’s very hard for me to justify dissatisfaction with my life when I look at things from this perspective.  I’m just too grateful for what I have when I look at it this way.

Why perspective matters

When I look at this list through the perspective of those who don’t have what I already have, it reminds me just how blessed I truly am. When I look at my life through this lens, it’s easy for me to make peace with where I am. 

Related Article:20 Heartfelt Ways to Say Thank You

When I look through my life focused on what I *haven’t *created or achieved, it’s much, much easier to feel unfulfilled. I’m not at peace when I evaluate my life based on my unfulfilled dreams.  How at peace I am with my life has everything to do with which perspective I choose to take.

In playing this perspective game, you come to see all of the wonderful things you have already created in your life.  You are focused on what you HAVE rather than what you DON’T have.  This projects a vibe that shouts out “I am fortunate in so many ways!”

A message like this becomes reinforced in your reality, allowing more and more good things to come into your life. The universe must continue to bless you, if you believe you are blessed.

Work within the paradox!

So, if you are wanting to use the Law of Attraction to improve your quality of life, make sure you are working within the paradox.  You’ve gotta make peace with what is before something better will come along. 

Remember, your life is great right here and now, regardless of where you stand.  *There are always dreams you have achieved, and there are always reasons to be grateful. *When you acknowledge this truth and declare your life to be great, your life will reflect greatness back to you in spades.

How is your life already great? Why is where you stand a wonderful place to be? Feel free to comment below and declare the greatness of your life right now!

XO, Andrea

posts.title: They Put a Pre-School in a Nursing Home, What Happened Next...I'm Speechless!
posts.markdown: While it makes sense to think that nursing homes are typically socially active places, it is not entirely uncommon for the elderly folks who occupy them to experience symptoms of depression and social isolation.   In an effort to combat this feeling of loneliness that their residents might feel, the Inter-Generational Learning Center in Providence Mount St. Vincent, Seattle, put a pre-school in their nursing home.  The effect that it had one everyone’s lives was noticeably immediate, and everyone was pleasantly surprised to see the incredible difference that it was making for both the seniors and the kids. Filmmaker Evan Briggs loved the idea of the this story so much that he decided to document the story and then turn it into a film, hoping to raise awareness about this unique and innovative project. **Present Perfect Trailer** I know when I was younger I loved hanging out with my grandpa; he was always showing me the tools in his garage and telling me crazy stories.  Hopefully more and more nursing homes will consider incorporating pre-school programs into their residents’ lives.

posts.title: Which Psychic Gift is Strongest In You?
posts.markdown: All of us possess some level of psychic ability, whether we’re aware of it or not.  Maybe you’ve noticed that you have a subtle way of picking up on things before they happen or you’re a master at figuring out people’s true motives, or maybe you’re just really good at knowing when not to do something.   These are all signs that your psychic ability is in good health. The four most common psychic intuitions are: clairvoyance (seeing), clairaudience (hearing), clairsentience (feeling), and claircognizance (knowing). You’re probably gifted in all of these areas, but there is likely just one that is your strongest and most proficient.   Clairsentience and claircognizance tend to be the most heightened among people, but you can try these exercises to figure exactly which one you exhibit most: **To test your ‘clairvoyance’** Close your eyes and try to picture how your body appears as it is now.  For example, I’m sitting on my couch.  I’d try to think to think about as much detail as I could about how I exist right now.   Am I sitting down?  What kind of clothes do I have on?  Do I look happy, sad or indifferent?  The more crystal clear you can make this picture of yourself, the more clairvoyant you are said to be. **To test your ‘clairaudience’** Close your eyes again, but this time focus solely on all of the different noises and sounds that fill the air around you.  Then, slowly work to eliminate each sound from your head until you find the silence that lies underneath all of the sound.   Once you’ve found this low, universal vibration, listen to your heart beating and the sound of your lungs working.  This can take days to achieve, but if you can, then you are likely clairaudient. **To test ‘clairsentience’** This test requires that you take a photograph of a person that you do not personally know, but whom someone close to you knows.  Practice analyzing all of the different feelings and emotions you get when you look at the picture of this person.   Do you feel like you can trust them?  What kind of person do you think they are?  Good or bad, write down your thoughts and then discuss them with your friend.   If you find that your predictions or thoughts about the person were accurate or significant, you are probably clairsentient. **To test ‘claircognizance’** This exercise requires you to look inward, asking for guidance and direction from your higher being.  Once you’ve asked for this guidance, start by writing down a question onto the piece of paper.   Then start jotting down whatever thoughts begin flowing through your mind.  Simply write down the words as they come to you; try not to think about what the words or thoughts mean, simply let your thoughts flow and write them down as they come. If you remain consistent with this exercise, your claircognizant ability will eventually become quite prominent, and if you begin to receive messages that are specific or that seem important to you at that time, then you’re likely very claircognizant.

posts.title: Twin That Was Pronounced Dead at Birth Responds to Mother and Father's Touch
posts.markdown: It’s not very often that you hear such a miraculous and uplifting story that you have to simply open your mouth and say, “wow”. While I will never be able to experience what it’s like to be pregnant, I can imagine that carrying around a little ball of love with you for nine months has to come with extreme attachment and bonding.  To be told that one of your newborn children isn’t going to make it to the morning is probably one of the most heartbreaking moments in a parent’s life. The video below details the truly magical tale of Kate and David Ogg, who, after trying for years to conceive, finally received the great news that Kate would be having twins.  The elation and anticipation for their unborn children was immeasurable. But at just six-and-a-half months pregnant, the twins were on their way out of their mother.  They were ready, even if their parents were not. They were told that they had been blessed with both a boy and a girl, but that their son, Jamie, was not going to make it through the premature pregnancy.  Kate quickly told her husband to take off all of his clothes and climb into bed with her and Jamie, wrapping him in their warmth. The two loving, but now sorrowful parents held their baby tightly in their arms, hoping that he might stir, ready to come into the world, when they suddenly felt him move. Doctors have no idea how to describe Jamie’s unlikely survival, but his mother knows: it was the warmth and touch of his loving parents that brought him into this world alive and happy.

posts.title: Los Angeles is Turning Old Motels Into 500 Apartments for Homeless Vets
posts.markdown: If you’ve been to Los Angeles in the past five years or so, then you know just how much of a homeless problem the city has.  What’s even worse is that so many of these homeless folks are veterans who once served our country. In an effort to house these homeless veterans, the City of Los Angeles has a new plan to renovate old motels and hospitals, turning them into 500 new apartments for homeless veterans. How will it work?  First, developers purchase the rundown properties and build them into the efficiency apartments discussed above.  Then, homeless veterans will use vouchers, gained from the **[Department of Veteran Affairs](http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-motel-homeless-conversions-20160527-snap-story.html)**, to pay for their rent. The vouchers given to the homeless vets expire after 15 years, and the deal is set up so that landlords will earn a profit as well.  Not to mention, residents of these abodes are eligible for supportive services like case management and counseling. This is easily recognizable as a step in the right direction after learning, from the Los Angeles Homeless Services Authority, that there were **[2,733 homeless veterans](https://documents.lahsa.org/Planning/homelesscount/2015/factsheet/LACity.pdf)** on any given night in the city last year. “Instead of allowing blighted properties to decay, let’s use them to make powerful change in our communities by giving our veterans the access to services and housing that they need and deserve,” Mayor Eric Garcetti said in a statement. The announcement of this new plan to help homeless veterans comes after the city failed to deliver on its promise to **[end veteran homelessness by the end of last year](http://www.huffingtonpost.com/steve-peck/why-garcettis-missed-dead_b_8074200.html)**.

posts.title: You Won't Beleive What Apple Cider Vinegar Does To Your Face
posts.markdown: You don’t really hear much about the benefits that **[apple cider vinegar](http://authoritynutrition.com/6-proven-health-benefits-of-apple-cider-vinegar/)** provides for your skin.  It costs less than practically every other face product on the market, yet still offers the same positive effects.  It combats acne and reduces the appearance of age spots. **[Alpha hydroxy acids](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alpha_hydroxy_acid)**are one of the active molecules found in apple cider vinegar, which help to remove dead skin cells.  These acids can be found in the expensive face products, but the apple cider vinegar holds much more of its content. If you’re looking to use it for age spots, just grab a cotton ball and apply a small amount of diluted apple cider vinegar to it.  Then dab the spots with the cotton ball, leaving the substance on your face for about 20-30 minutes before rinsing it off. The acidic nature of apple cider vinegar provides natural antibacterial and antifungal properties, helping heal and prevent acne and skin infections.  It unclogs the pores, helping your skin to breathe, which in turn keeps pimples from forming.  Furthermore, it balances the pH balance of your skin, giving it a nice balance between oily and dry. Apple cider vinegar is a strong solution and it can damage your skin, so it’s important to dilute it before applying it to your person.  **You can always make your own face wash using this method:** **Ingredients – **1 tablespoon of apple cider vinegar + 3 tablespoons of water **How to prepare – **Using a small bowl, mix one tablespoon of apple cider vinegar with 3 tablespoons of water.  After you wet your face with water, rub the combination all over your skin using a cotton ball.  Your best option is organic apple cider vinegar, as this type includes the natural enzymes, bacteria and minerals that provide the positive effects. (h/t [**My Life Style**](http://www.myilifestyle.com/what-happens-to-your-face-after-washing-it-with-apple-cider-vinegar-this-will-surprise-you/))

posts.title: Learn to Grow Lemons From Seed and Have Lemons for Life
posts.markdown: You always hear the phrase ‘when life gives you lemons..’ being said when times are tough.  But it takes on a whole new meaning after you learn how to grow your own lemon tree, because now when life gives you lemons, you simply plant and grow more lemons! Growing your own lemon tree is easy and highly rewarding, making it a fun little side project if you’re looking for something to do or simply want a steady supply of lemons. Lemon trees grow their very hardest when they’re outdoors, year-round, in a hot and sunny climate.  However, they can be grown inside during seasons with cold or not ideal climates. **To start growing your lemon tree – Procure the following items** - An organic lemon since non-organic lemons often contain non-germinating seeds - Fertile potting soil, preferably containing peat, vermiculite, perlite, and natural fertilizers - A planting pot that is six inches wide and six inches deep (will be used for sprouting) - A seedling pot that is about 24 inches wide by 12 inches deep - A sunny, indoor growing location and possibly a grow light **Use these steps to grow your lemon tree** 1. Moisten the potting soil so that it is damp, but not soaked, all the way through. 2. Fill the smaller pot with soil, all the way up to an inch below the rim. 3. Cut open your lemon and remove a seed. Remove all of the pulp from its surface. A good way to do this is to simply suck on it until it is clean. 4. Do not delay to plant. The seed must still be moist when it is buried into the soil. Plant the seed about half an inch deep in the middle of the pot. 5. Spray the soil that is directly above the seed gently with water from a spray bottle. 6. Cover the pot with clear plastic wrap, seal the edges with a good rubber band, and poke small holes in the top with a pencil. 7. Place the pot in a warm, sunny location. 8. Spray on more water occasionally, not allowing the soil to dry out. Do not cause water to puddle though. Just keep the soil somewhat moist. 9. After about two weeks, when the sproutling emerges, take the plastic covering off. If you need additional light for your lemon plant, you can use a grow light to supplement the sun’s light. 10. Take care of the young plant by keeping the soil damp, by making sure it gets at least eight full hours of light per day, and by giving it moderate doses of organic fertilizer. 11. Watch over your plant to ensure it is not attacked by bugs or diseases. Prune off brown, dead leaves when necessary. Use pesticides if you must. Protect your new lemon tree! 12. When the plant outgrows its small pot, put it in the larger pot. You will go through much the same procedure when you re-plant it as when you first planted. Younger plants need more water than older plants, but they all do need adequate water. Don’t starve your poor plant after all that work of growing it! Not only is it cheaper to grow your own lemons, but you gain real experience growing plant life, making it valuable as well as educational.  Not to mention, you pretty much have fresh lemons whenever you want them and the lemon tree is a stylish piece of home decor. So, take on a new summer project and see if you can grow your own lemon tree.  And be sure to share this fun idea with someone who loves fresh lemons and growing fruit! h/t [**EcoSnippet**](http://www.ecosnippets.com/gardening/grow-lemons-from-seed/)

You always hear the phrase ‘when life gives you lemons..’ being said when times are tough.  But it takes on a whole new meaning after you learn how to grow your own lemon tree, because now when life gives you lemons, you simply plant and grow more lemons!

Growing your own lemon tree is easy and highly rewarding, making it a fun little side project if you’re looking for something to do or simply want a steady supply of lemons.

Lemon trees grow their very hardest when they’re outdoors, year-round, in a hot and sunny climate.  However, they can be grown inside during seasons with cold or not ideal climates.

To start growing your lemon tree – Procure the following items

  • An organic lemon since non-organic lemons often contain non-germinating seeds
  • Fertile potting soil, preferably containing peat, vermiculite, perlite, and natural fertilizers
  • A planting pot that is six inches wide and six inches deep (will be used for sprouting)
  • A seedling pot that is about 24 inches wide by 12 inches deep
  • A sunny, indoor growing location and possibly a grow light

Use these steps to grow your lemon tree

  1. Moisten the potting soil so that it is damp, but not soaked, all the way through.
  2. Fill the smaller pot with soil, all the way up to an inch below the rim.
  3. Cut open your lemon and remove a seed. Remove all of the pulp from its surface. A good way to do this is to simply suck on it until it is clean.
  4. Do not delay to plant. The seed must still be moist when it is buried into the soil. Plant the seed about half an inch deep in the middle of the pot.
  5. Spray the soil that is directly above the seed gently with water from a spray bottle.
  6. Cover the pot with clear plastic wrap, seal the edges with a good rubber band, and poke small holes in the top with a pencil.
  7. Place the pot in a warm, sunny location.
  8. Spray on more water occasionally, not allowing the soil to dry out. Do not cause water to puddle though. Just keep the soil somewhat moist.
  9. After about two weeks, when the sproutling emerges, take the plastic covering off. If you need additional light for your lemon plant, you can use a grow light to supplement the sun’s light.
  10. Take care of the young plant by keeping the soil damp, by making sure it gets at least eight full hours of light per day, and by giving it moderate doses of organic fertilizer.
  11. Watch over your plant to ensure it is not attacked by bugs or diseases. Prune off brown, dead leaves when necessary. Use pesticides if you must. Protect your new lemon tree!
  12. When the plant outgrows its small pot, put it in the larger pot. You will go through much the same procedure when you re-plant it as when you first planted. Younger plants need more water than older plants, but they all do need adequate water. Don’t starve your poor plant after all that work of growing it!

Not only is it cheaper to grow your own lemons, but you gain real experience growing plant life, making it valuable as well as educational.  Not to mention, you pretty much have fresh lemons whenever you want them and the lemon tree is a stylish piece of home decor.

So, take on a new summer project and see if you can grow your own lemon tree.  And be sure to share this fun idea with someone who loves fresh lemons and growing fruit!

posts.markdown: Emotional abuse and manipulation happens more often than you might think.  The worst part is that sometimes you don’t even realize that it’s happening, which is what makes it so toxic.  A person who is good at it will make you miserable and confused as to why. posts.title: 5 Ways To Figure Out Your True Purpose In Life
posts.markdown: As humans, one thing that comes naturally to us is the desire to produce, create, or design.  We see our work (and other services that we do) as reflections of ourselves.  We thrive on positive feedback and enjoy doing things that other people love or get excited about. Which means that when we can’t find something to be passionate about, or are lacking positive feedback on the work that we’re doing, we suffer in many ways. But, we can change our perspective and take full responsibility for our lives.  You can only understand your purpose in life once you genuinely understand who you are as a person. And here are five ways to help you get started on this journey: **List out your positive natural skills and abilities** Maybe you’re at your best when painting or writing, maybe you excel at helping and healing others, maybe you’re at your best when you’re pushing your body physically–whatever it is, figure out what you’re good at, even if you can’t transform it into a career immediately. **List out your natural interests or hobbies** For me, I’d put down things like: running, hiking, mountain biking, writing, etc.  For you it might be reading books for hours on end, or managing social media connections, or solving difficult problems using math and code.   Your natural interests say a lot about who you are and they’re important to know, because once you piece them all together, you can really start to solve the puzzle. **See if anything from the first two overlap** Living your dream life requires a few things: interest, ability, dedication and motivation.  Toss out any one of these and you are not likely to achieve it.  There’s always chance and luck, but they’re too fickle to focus on.   Focus on the things you can control: what do you want, can you do it well, and how are you going to make a living doing it. **How do you want to be remembered when you leave this world?** Death is the great equalizer for all of mankind.  So, when your final moments are upon you, do you want your loved ones to remember you for your accomplished career or how often you spent time with family and friends?  Maybe you want them to remember how kind and generous you were, or maybe you don’t want to be remembered at all. All of these things can help you figure out what you’re ‘meant’ to do in life. **Think about things you wouldn’t mind doing every single day if you had to** Think about your version of a perfect life real quick.  What would you love to spend your time doing every day if you had the choice to do *anything*.  Without taking into consideration status, titles, accolades or achievements, how would you live your life?   Try not to be concerned with how your life looks to others, if this is your focus then you are not living for yourself. h/t [**Bustle**](http://www.bustle.com/articles/107298-9-ways-to-figure-out-what-youre-meant-to-do)

posts.title: 7 Things Only a Pisces Girl Will Understand
posts.markdown: Being a Pisces means a lot of different things, but mainly that you’re practical, compassionate and the most loving person you know.  If you’re a Pisces girl, then you will definitely be able to relate to these seven things! **You care a lot** The Pisces girl tends to be sort of ‘all or nothing,’ meaning that she either feels very deeply about things or doesn’t care at all.  As far as grey areas are concerned, the Pisces girl typically doesn’t deal in them. **You’re also practical and down to Earth** While you tend to feel things intensely, you never let it cloud your judgment or get the best of you.  Your pragmatism and practicality balance out your extreme emotions and feelings. **You dislike hurting other people’s feelings** Because of how much you genuinely care for others, it can be hard at times to turn people down or say no to people’s requests of you.  You’re always considerate of another person’s feelings. **You’re often the one people assume has her life together** Regardless of what’s going on with you emotionally, you always keep it together on the outside.  A calm, composed and happy demeanor leads many to believe that you rarely ever struggle with life’s problems. **Hanging out and relaxing at home is just as good as going out** A night out is always a good time, sure, but it will never compare to pajamas and movies with good food and good company.  The Pisces girl’s favorite activity is a night in with her best friends. **You’re chock-full of good ideas** Coming up with fun and creative solutions to problems is your forte as a Pisces girl.  People love hanging out with you because there’s rarely a dull moment. **You’re able to forgive and forget without even trying** Holding grudges has never been your style, and you probably couldn’t do it even if you tried.  Forgiving and moving forward is your preferred plan of action, unless that person had malicious intentions.   h/t [**Pop Xo**](http://www.popxo.com/2016/02/things-you-will-totally-get-if-you-are-a-pisces-girl/)

posts.title: 5 Signs You're a Highly Sensitive Individual
posts.markdown: There are those of us who simply cannot control our emotions as well as we would like to.  We’re the ones who cry when we see other people cry, simply because they’re sad and we think it’s sad that they’re sad and we don’t want them to be sad.   Highly sensitive people are often referred to as empaths.  Those who are more sensitive than your average person, those who feel *more*.  And science shows that about 15 to 20 percent of people have a gene that makes them more sensitive than others. If this sounds kind of like you, here are more signs that you’re a highly sensitive person: **Other people’s moods affect you more than they probably should** The highly sensitive person is incredibly attuned to the various different emotions, meaning they can easily sense them in others.  If you can tell exactly what kind of mood a person is in without them having to say a word, you’re likely an empath.   Empaths literally *feel* other people’s emotions, which can be harmful if you don’t know how to shield yourself from negative emotions. **Your observation skills are finely tuned** A highly sensitive person is also highly aware of the things that are happening around them.  Subtle things like tone of voice, slight facial expressions or cues, and tiny gestures provide you with a wealth of information about the setting you currently find yourself in. **You need your alone time** Highly sensitive people are constantly needing to shield and protect themselves from the various different energies and emotions surrounding them at any given time, which is exhausting. After social gatherings or extended periods of time without being alone, they’re likely to need a bit of downtime to recuperate and recharge. **You have an uncanny ability to anticipate the things that others need** For whatever reason, you simply know what a person needs in order for them to feel comfortable and at ease.  It most likely stems from your ability to recognize emotions and feelings, as well as the importance you place on the comfort and care of others. **Everything has a certain ‘feeling’ attached to it** Everything, from smells and colors to people, places, and even certain times, all have a specific ‘feeling’ to them.

posts.title: 10 Sources of Body Pain and How They're Related to Specific Emotional States
posts.markdown: Understanding what pain is will help you tremendously on your journey through life.  First and foremost, pain is energy.  Secondly, it is perception.  And lastly, pain is the physical manifestation that you feel.   Practically every bit of pain we’ve ever felt in our body is linked to various different emotional states.  These emotional states serve as warnings, indicating that we still have areas that need to be healed and subsequently grown from.  Learning our lessons and growing is the only way to rid ourselves of the pain. Pain in the body is quite literal.  Certain experiences trigger certain pains, telling you what the problem is; all you need to do is figure out the lesson behind all of it. Here are 10 types of body pain and their related emotional states: **Muscle pains** These are often a result of getting ‘stuck’ on different aspects of our lives.  Whether it be at work, at home, or battles within, learning to ebb and flow with the ever changing currents of your life will ease these pains. **Pain in the head** Headaches are associated with the inability to make a decision.  And migraines, being the older brother of headaches, occur when you know what decision you need to make do not make it.  To ease these pains, remember to make time for yourself to relax and unwind each day. **Neck pains** Pain in the neck is linked to forgiveness, whether it be forgiving others or yourself.  Reflect on the things you love about yourself as well as the things you love about those around you; this will help you become more aware and more capable of letting go. **Gum pain** Similar to neck pain, gum pain is tied to inaction regarding decision-making.  Be assertive, be confident and make choices with purpose. **Stomach pain** Pain in our stomachs are related to a lack of feeling whole or fulfilled in life.  It is the result of a void within ourselves, one that leaves us in pain. **Lower back pain** Stress caused by anxiety over finances or even just a general lack of emotional support can cause pain in the lower back.  This could be a sign that it’s time you ask for a raise or work to manage your money more efficiently. **Pain in the elbows** Elbow pain is correlated with resistance to any change that may be happening in your life.  Stiffness is indicative of stiffness in your life.  You may want to consider rocking the boat a little bit; stir things up and see what happens.  All you can really do anyway is let the flow take you; be like water. **Pain in the arms** Arm pain means that you’re carrying a burden, whether it be your own or that of another person’s.  Take time to reflect on this burden and decide whether or not you need to keep carrying it. **Hand pain** Hand pain is associated with how often you’re reaching out to others.  If you’re experiencing hand pain, attempt to make new friends or reconnect with an old one.  Make plans with your coworkers or neighbors.  Build new connections. **Pain in the teeth** Teeth pains are connected to consistent negative thought patterns, ones that repeat how much you dislike your current situation.  If you practice positive thought patterns, ones that focus on how your experiences flow through you with ease, you can relieve this pain. h/t [**Prevent Disease**](http://preventdisease.com/news/15/060815_20-Sources-Pain-Tied-To-Specific-Emotional-States.shtml)

posts.title: 5 Phrases That Are Better Than Saying 'I Love You'
posts.markdown: If you’ve ever fallen in love with someone then you know that love is not the type of emotion that can be adequately conveyed with three simple words.  Love is more than lusting after physical attraction, it’s more than anything we could ever imagine.   It’s about loving someone for who they are, flaws and all.  It’s about being a pillar of strength during tough times.  It’s about showing how much you care in little ways.  And one of the easiest ways to express love for your person is by using your words.  Words that mean more than a simple ‘I love you.’ Here are five phrases that express love better than the three words we’re all used to saying so often: **‘I’m lucky to be yours’** When you’ve fallen for someone pretty hard, feeling lucky comes easy.  It happens in those moments when you’re least expecting it, when you’re suddenly overcome with an intense realization that you want this to last forever.   When you start to feel that you are unworthy of this person’s love, time, and attention, don’t forget to tell them how grateful you are to have them in your life. **‘I’m sorry’** Knowing when you’re wrong and when to apologize for your actions, words, or behaviors, is much more important than throwing out a simple ‘I love you.’  If you get caught up in a fight or make a huge mistake and know you were in the wrong, own up to it.   You don’t need to waste your time trying to prove a point if you truly care about them.  Ask for forgiveness and move forward. **‘I forgive you’** In the same way that you should apologize, also be willing to forgive.  When you know that your partner is truly sorry, and their transgressions are forgivable, don’t hesitate to forgive them.  Holding grudges and staying upset is wasted energy, energy that could be spent on building and nurturing your relationship. **‘I support you’** Encouraging, motivating, and generally supporting your partner is something that they can’t get from anyone else.  It means the world when your partner has your back during times of uncertainty or change.   Never be afraid to reassure them that they’re more than capable of achieving their goals and that you’ll be by their side every step of the way. **‘I’m committed to you, to us’** Knowing that your partner is entirely faithful and committed to the love you two share is an amazing feeling.  Never hesitate to tell them that your heart is theirs or how often you think about them.   The open expression of commitment illustrates your love and sincerity for this feeling toward them.  When you’re feeling the love, tell them! h/t [**ReRules**](http://www.relrules.com/9-phrases-more-important-than-i-love-you/5/)

If you’ve ever fallen in love with someone then you know that love is not the type of emotion that can be adequately conveyed with three simple words.  Love is more than lusting after physical attraction, it’s more than anything we could ever imagine.  

It’s about loving someone for who they are, flaws and all.  It’s about being a pillar of strength during tough times.  It’s about showing how much you care in little ways.  And one of the easiest ways to express love for your person is by using your words.  Words that mean more than a simple ‘I love you.’

Here are five phrases that express love better than the three words we’re all used to saying so often:

‘I’m lucky to be yours’

When you’ve fallen for someone pretty hard, feeling lucky comes easy.  It happens in those moments when you’re least expecting it, when you’re suddenly overcome with an intense realization that you want this to last forever.  

When you start to feel that you are unworthy of this person’s love, time, and attention, don’t forget to tell them how grateful you are to have them in your life.

‘I’m sorry’

Knowing when you’re wrong and when to apologize for your actions, words, or behaviors, is much more important than throwing out a simple ‘I love you.’  If you get caught up in a fight or make a huge mistake and know you were in the wrong, own up to it.  

You don’t need to waste your time trying to prove a point if you truly care about them.  Ask for forgiveness and move forward.

‘I forgive you’

In the same way that you should apologize, also be willing to forgive.  When you know that your partner is truly sorry, and their transgressions are forgivable, don’t hesitate to forgive them.  Holding grudges and staying upset is wasted energy, energy that could be spent on building and nurturing your relationship.

‘I support you’

Encouraging, motivating, and generally supporting your partner is something that they can’t get from anyone else.  It means the world when your partner has your back during times of uncertainty or change.  

Never be afraid to reassure them that they’re more than capable of achieving their goals and that you’ll be by their side every step of the way.

‘I’m committed to you, to us’

Knowing that your partner is entirely faithful and committed to the love you two share is an amazing feeling.  Never hesitate to tell them that your heart is theirs or how often you think about them.  

The open expression of commitment illustrates your love and sincerity for this feeling toward them.  When you’re feeling the love, tell them!

h/t ReRules

posts.title: Before a Rare Disease Took His Life, Sam Revealed His 3 Secrets to Happiness
posts.markdown: Diagnosed with a rare disease called ‘progeria,’ 17-year-old Sam Berns lead anything but a normal life.  Three months before his passing, he gave an inspiring and powerful speech illustrating his struggles to overcome the obstacles he faced every day, as well as his methods to finally beat them. Progeria, the extremely rare disease that Sam suffered from, causes rapid aging and a slew of other debilitating symptoms.  But Sam never gave up on living a happy life, and he wants you to remember that you are capable of doing the same. Sam’s TEDx video is just one thing he did to try to create a better world for the people around him.  You can learn more about Sam by watching his HBO documentary, and you can learn more about Progeria at the Progeria Research Foundation.

posts.title: 3 Critical Life Lessons Everyone Can Learn From Being Single
posts.markdown: If you’ve recently found yourself single or have been single for a while, I have some good news: you’re growing.  Being single affords you many opportunities and freedoms that people in relationships do not have.  Think about it–no one to answer to, no one else to worry about but yourself, no trying to figure out someone else’s life. A large importance is placed on relationships because, well, that’s kind of our purpose as humans; we’re meant to get together and make babies.  But that doesn’t mean you need to be in a relationship *all the time*.   Being single actually helps us learn a few important life lessons.  They can be rough lessons to learn, but you’re better off for having learned them! **Spending time alone** Sometimes when we have a partner, we get used to certain comforts and develop dependencies around them.  Sometimes we even stop doing the things that make us, us.  When you spend time alone, you remember all the things you used to spend your time doing; you know, the hobbies and activities that you call your own. Being alone also gives you the downtime necessary to reflect on the happenings of your life.  You can think about past mistakes and grow from them. **You are more than enough for yourself** One of the best things about learning to live comfortably alone is that you don’t seek out validation from anyone other than yourself.  If you gain nothing else from being alone, try to learn this.  Once you start to live life for yourself, numerous doors open up in your world, each one brimming with potential.   Because the truth is that you are the only one who knows what will make you happy.  And only you can decide what is best for you.  Remember to do right by yourself before anyone else. **Love can be found in all parts of life, not just your relationships** When you’re single, you start to discover love in different areas of your life.  You start to develop an understanding of love that is greater and much deeper than before.  This helps you to love unconditionally at all times, regardless of what is going on or who you’re with.  And in turn, you become a better version of yourself. Being single is not something to be feared or looked down upon.  It is an opportunity for growth, an opportunity to truly learn about yourself.  Remember that you are the only person you need in this world and move forward with confidence every day!

Being alone also gives you the downtime necessary to reflect on the happenings of your life.  You can think about past mistakes and grow from them.

You are more than enough for yourself

One of the best things about learning to live comfortably alone is that you don’t seek out validation from anyone other than yourself.  If you gain nothing else from being alone, try to learn this.  Once you start to live life for yourself, numerous doors open up in your world, each one brimming with potential.  

Because the truth is that you are the only one who knows what will make you happy.  And only you can decide what is best for you.  Remember to do right by yourself before anyone else.

Love can be found in all parts of life, not just your relationships

When you’re single, you start to discover love in different areas of your life.  You start to develop an understanding of love that is greater and much deeper than before.  This helps you to love unconditionally at all times, regardless of what is going on or who you’re with.  And in turn, you become a better version of yourself.

Being single is not something to be feared or looked down upon.  It is an opportunity for growth, an opportunity to truly learn about yourself.  Remember that you are the only person you need in this world and move forward with confidence every day!

posts.title: This Colorado City Created Affordable Housing Almost Overnight
posts.markdown: Housing is easily one of the most expensive parts of anyone’s budget, with most experts suggesting that you only spend about a third of your monthly income on housing, max.  But if you’re like the millions of people around the country who are currently spending at least half or more of their income on housing, you know life can be tough. **[Durango, Colorado](https://www.planning.org/events/nationalconferenceactivity/9001901/)**, is one city that was seeking a way to create affordable housing, and instead of building new infrastructure, decided to tweak some of their rules and policies.  Much of how they did this surrounds ‘Accessory Dwelling Units,’ which are basically the finished basements, above-garage studios, rebuilt carriage houses, and other similar type buildings that rest on lots typically zoned for single-family homes. City officials realized that Durango already had a plethora of ADUs in and around the city, but no one could live in them because of the restrictions put in place that tightly regulate who can live in them. Starting in 2009, Durango worked on overhauling its Land Use and Development Code.  Under their revised code, standards were put in place to guide the development of new ADUs, including a limit on how many occupants they could have (five unrelated persons), rules on how small the living space could be (550 sq. ft.), rules on owner-occupied home requirements (meaning landlords cannot be absent while renting out both their home and ADU), and bans on short-term vacation rentals like through AirBnB.   Existing ADUs were the only real problem with the new code, because no one knew what to do with them.  Most of them were considered illegal, so to bypass this with as little pain as possible, a type of “ADU amnesty” was put in place as officials asked owners of current ADUs with residents to come forward. Having an established ADU that was completely under the radar, meaning it wasn’t official in any way, landed people fines ranging from $2000 to $9000, but they got to keep their ADUs, they were just logged into the city’s inventory database. This ADU amnesty program was largely successful, as this sort of informal and underground economy was regularized with the coming forward of more and more people who were operating unofficial ADUs.   Some members of the Durango community opposed this new code, suggesting that it would turn much of the neighborhoods and residential areas into ‘slums,’ instead of viewing the work as progress toward affordable housing.   Durango’s story comes at a perfect time, as **[more and more communities](http://www.seattletimes.com/opinion/mother-in-law-units-are-key-to-housing-affordability/) from [around the country](http://www.bostonglobe.com/opinion/2016/04/30/how-grandma-can-help-housing-crunch/BBul6fbzcinQ4iEPtsmvVJ/story.html?)** struggle to address similar housing problems.   What do you think about Durango’s push to create affordable housing?  Are they doing it the right way? h/t [**City Lab**](http://www.citylab.com/design/2016/05/how-one-colorado-city-instantly-created-affordable-housing/483027/)

posts.title: Man Attempts To Hug a Wild Lion. What Happens Next Stunned Me!
posts.markdown: It’s always amazing (and terrifying) to get up close and personal with the wild animals that share this world with us.  While most of us will only experience them comfortably from the other side of a glass wall or tall fence, some people have made it their life to not only understand these beasts, but to develop real connections with them. **[South African zookeeper Kevin Richardson](http://www.lionwhisperer.co.za/)** is one such a person. Known as the “Lion Whisperer,” Kevin was able to build and maintain strong bonds with the wild lions living near Pretoria, South Africa.  So much so that they accept him as family.   This deep closeness gives Kevin the opportunity to garner an understanding of them that goes beyond what we typically see; acknowledging each member of the pride for his or her unique behaviors, instincts and emotions. Watch as Kevin demonstrates his connection with these magnificent creatures, even placing his arm in one of their mouths will full confidence that his lion companion will not harm him. Kevin hopes to one day own and operate the Kevin Richardson Wildlife Sanctuary, with the goal of “providing a self-sustaining African carnivore sanctuary for the purposes of wild species preservation through education, awareness and funding, especially pertaining to the rapid decline of large carnivores in Africa due to habitat loss, human-predator conflict, unscrupulous hunting, disease and their illegal trade.”

posts.title: Which Psychic Gift is Strongest In You?
posts.markdown: All of us possess some level of psychic ability, whether we’re aware of it or not.  Maybe you’ve noticed that you have a subtle way of picking up on things before they happen or you’re a master at figuring out people’s true motives, or maybe you’re just really good at knowing when not to do something.   These are all signs that your psychic ability is in good health. The four most common psychic intuitions are: clairvoyance (seeing), clairaudience (hearing), clairsentience (feeling), and claircognizance (knowing). You’re probably gifted in all of these areas, but there is likely just one that is your strongest and most proficient.   Clairsentience and claircognizance tend to be the most heightened among people, but you can try these exercises to figure exactly which one you exhibit most: **To test your ‘clairvoyance’** Close your eyes and try to picture how your body appears as it is now.  For example, I’m sitting on my couch.  I’d try to think to think about as much detail as I could about how I exist right now.   Am I sitting down?  What kind of clothes do I have on?  Do I look happy, sad or indifferent?  The more crystal clear you can make this picture of yourself, the more clairvoyant you are said to be. **To test your ‘clairaudience’** Close your eyes again, but this time focus solely on all of the different noises and sounds that fill the air around you.  Then, slowly work to eliminate each sound from your head until you find the silence that lies underneath all of the sound.   Once you’ve found this low, universal vibration, listen to your heart beating and the sound of your lungs working.  This can take days to achieve, but if you can, then you are likely clairaudient. **To test ‘clairsentience’** This test requires that you take a photograph of a person that you do not personally know, but whom someone close to you knows.  Practice analyzing all of the different feelings and emotions you get when you look at the picture of this person.   Do you feel like you can trust them?  What kind of person do you think they are?  Good or bad, write down your thoughts and then discuss them with your friend.   If you find that your predictions or thoughts about the person were accurate or significant, you are probably clairsentient. **To test ‘claircognizance’** This exercise requires you to look inward, asking for guidance and direction from your higher being.  Once you’ve asked for this guidance, start by writing down a question onto the piece of paper.   Then start jotting down whatever thoughts begin flowing through your mind.  Simply write down the words as they come to you; try not to think about what the words or thoughts mean, simply let your thoughts flow and write them down as they come. If you remain consistent with this exercise, your claircognizant ability will eventually become quite prominent, and if you begin to receive messages that are specific or that seem important to you at that time, then you’re likely very claircognizant. h/t [**Disclose.TV**](http://www.disclose.tv/news/we_all_have_psychic_gifts_which_one_is_your_strongest/129522)

posts.title: 5 Ways to Protect Yourself from Psychic Attacks
posts.markdown: For the past couple of days I’d been having these crazy bouts of insecurity, confusion and sadness, and I could not for the life of me understand why.  I’d been quite happy and carefree the week before, so why the sudden despair and feelings of uncertainty?  As it would turn out, my girlfriend had been stressing out immensely, thinking about the upcoming changes in both of our lives.   I was unknowingly picking up on all of the energy and negativity that she was feeling, and because much of it revolved around me and our relationship, she was unknowingly directing all of that negative energy at me.  When this happens, the person being sent the energy often cannot tell the difference between their own natural thoughts and these thoughts that are being sent to them, which causes even more confusion. Oftentimes people are unknowingly psychically attacking someone, while other times they can be doing it on purpose.  It’s important to recognize when you’re being attacked and what you can do to stop it. Here are five tips for deflecting psychic attacks: **Ask for help from friends, healers and mentors** If you’re not sure where your negative energies, thoughts and feelings are coming from, it can be helpful for your friends and family to bring you into their positive thoughts and feelings.  Don’t be afraid to ask them to think about you during their prayers, meditations and healing practices. **Channel your thoughts elsewhere** This might take some time, but you will ultimately learn to do it.  Whenever you find yourself vulnerable, thinking negative and poisonous things about yourself, a thing or a person, try focusing those thoughts on something constructive or useful. Having a list of goals or positive things you wish for in your life is helpful when picking out something to channel your energy to. **Focus on the good things in your life** Psychic attacks often focus on the vulnerabilities that you have, seeking to exploit the darkness inside of you.  When you feel this happening, take yourself to the happy moments of your life and spend some time in the light. **Stay consistent with healthy habits and rituals** Psychic attacks also work by throwing off your balance.  Losing that balance in your life makes it easier for negativity and darkness to overcome the positivity.   Fortify your balance by keeping consistent with the different aspects of your life, like sleep, diet, exercise and self-reflection. **Try not to retaliate** When people attack you they are opening themselves up to vulnerability.  While our energies have no limits, our attention is finite.   When you spend more time focusing your attention on attacking someone else, you are effectively taking away the attention that you should be spending on yourself, working to create the healthy world that you want.

posts.title: 5 Negative Thought Patterns You Need To Drop Now
posts.markdown: Negative thought patterns can easily turn a good day into an absolutely terrible day, especially for those of us with anxiety.  I try my hardest to avoid any negative thoughts, whether they’re directed at me or at others, because I recognize that thinking negatively affects me on both a physical and emotional level. But it can be hard at times and a lot of us fall into these patterns of negativity without even realizing it.  Here are five negative thought patterns that you should probably get out of your life, and fast: **Catastrophizing** This happens when we perceive a tiny mistake or misfortune in our lives as being the one thing that will ultimately ruin *everything* for us.  Not only does this exaggeration not help us, it fosters anxiety, fear, stress and helplessness.  Don’t believe that the worst has happened before it’s happened. **Generalizing** I think that everyone, somewhere deep inside of them, knows that when they say ‘blanket’ statements that unfairly group individuals together without a second glance, that there’s some element of dishonesty in what they’re saying.  Stating that everything is either ‘this way’ or ‘that way’ is a poor way of viewing the world.  Don’t make it a habit. **Personalizing** As much as we would like to think that we are at the center of the universe, we are not.  The world does not belong to you just as much as it does not belong to me.  Always acknowledge that people will act the way they act because they’re sorting through issues of their own, and that it probably doesn’t have anything to do with you (don’t take things so personally).   **Filtering** Filtering is something that we all do.  Shockingly, people only like to hear things that resonate positively with what they believe or understand.  Try to avoid only hearing what you want to hear.  Take the good with the bad, because if you only have one side of the picture, how you can fully understand it?   **“Should”-ing** Constantly telling yourself that you *should* have done this or *should *have done that is bad for one’s view of him or herself.  The word ‘should’ denotes that we’re incapable or lacking in certain areas.  You’re basically telling yourself you’re not good enough or didn’t do well enough.  If you truly think you *should* be doing something then make the effort to make it happen.  If it’s not worth doing, then don’t bother with it, and certainly don’t stress over it.
